[action]: Parley. Add Jeremiah Pierce to the victory display. Then, test [willpower] (4). Place 1 doom on the current agenda for each point you fail by (this can cause the current agenda to advance).

name: Billy Cooper
pack_name: Return to the Night of the Zealot
text:
Spawn - Easttown.
Forced - After a [[Monster]] enemy is defeated at Billy Cooper's location: Add Billy Cooper to the victory display.

name: Alma Hill
pack_name: Return to the Night of the Zealot
text:
Spawn - Southside.
[action]: Parley. Draw the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Then, add Alma Hill to the victory display.

name: Bandolier
text:
You have two additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Weapon]] assets.
While you have [[Weapon]] assets held in 2 or more hand slots, you get +1 [willpower].

name: Blackjack
text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you perform this attack against an enemy engaged with another investigator, you deal +1 damage for this attack if you succeed, and no damage if you fail.

name: Preposterous Sketches
text:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Draw 3 cards.

name: Strange Solution
text: You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Strange Solution (Unidentified), and only if you have "identified the solution" in your Campaign Log. Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Strange Solution: Choose an investigator at your location to gain 2 resources and draw 1 card.

name: Contraband
text:
Choose an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Either (choose one):
- Place 2 ammo or supply tokens on that asset and draw 1 card.
- Double the number of ammo or supply tokens on that asset.

name: Think on Your Feet
text:
Fast. Play when an enemy enters your location.
Immediately move to a connecting location. (The enemy still enters your previous location.)

name: Rite of Seeking
text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. You get +2 [willpower] for this test. If you succeed you discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, after this test resolves lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.

name: Clarity of Mind
text:
Uses (4 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 2 horror from among investigators at your location.

name: Oops!
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less while attacking an enemy.
Deal this attack's damage to any enemy at your location. If the attacked enemy is engaged with another investigator, this attack deals no damage to that investigator.

name: Rise to the Occasion
text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing, and only if the difficulty of that test is higher than your base skill value.
Rise to the Occasion gets +X [wild] icons, where X is the difference between your base skill and this test's difficulty (to a maximum of +3 [wild] icons).

name: Through the Gates
text: Revelation - Draw the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, remove that card from the game. Then, search your deck, discard pile, hand, and all play areas for each other copy of that card you own, and remove them from the game, as well.

name: Warren Observatory
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues at Warren Observatory: Discard 3 cards from the top of your deck for each clue just discovered.

name: Enthralled Security Guard
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard is evaded: It is defeated.

name: Clover Club Lounge
text: Forced - After Clover Club Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Clover Club Stage into play. While it is Act 1, Clover Club Lounge gains: "[action]: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is an [[Ally]] asset, you may put it into play. Otherwise, draw it. (Limit once per round.)"

name: Clover Club Stage
text:
Clover Club Bar is connected to Clover Club Stage.
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Stage gains: "[action] Spend 1 resource: Place that resource on Clover Club Stage.
[free] If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on Clover Club Stage: Gain 1 [per_investigator] clues from the token pool. (Group limit once per game.)"

name: Caught Cheating
text: Surge. Revelation - Each player who has "cheated" must lose 2 resources and take 1 damage.

name: Raise the Stakes
text: Revelation - You must (choose one): - Remember that you have "cheated." - Lose 5 resources. - Put Raise the Stakes into play in your threat area. It gains: "Each [[Criminal]] enemy at your location loses aloof. If it is Act 2 or 3, each [[Criminal]] enemy engaged with you gets +1 fight and +1 evade."

name: Exhibit Hall
text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.

name: Exhibit Hall
text: [action] [action]: Gain 2 clues (from the token bank). Then, if Hunting Horror is in play, place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned. Otherwise, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in the Museum Halls. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Dark Bidding
text: Revelation - Attach Dark Bidding to Hunting Horror, even if it is out of play. Dark Bidding remains attached to Hunting Horror if it enters the void. Forced - When Hunting Horror attacks an investigator: That investigator must take 1 additional damage and 1 additional horror. Heal 2 damage from Hunting Horror. Discard Dark Bidding. (Max once per attack.)

name: Night Beyond Void
text: Revelation - Place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned, even if it is out of play.

name: The Conductor
text: Spawn - Leftmost location. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When The Conductor is defeated: Attach it to the current agenda. After you advance the attached agenda, draw The Conductor. Forced - When The Conductor's location leaves play: Instead of discarding The Conductor, move it one location to the right.

name: Engine Car
text: Engine Car is connected to the location to the left of it. Engine Car cannot be investigated. Forced - After you reveal Engine Car: Put the set-aside Engineer into play at the Engine Car.

name: Freight Car
text: Freight Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator on the Freight Car must test [agility] (1). Each investigator who fails must test [agility] (1) again. each investigator who fails this second test is pulled into the vortex above and is defeated.

name: Baggage Car
text:
Baggage Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.
Baggage Car cannot be investigated.
[action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Discover 1 clue in the Baggage Car.

name: Engineer
text: [action] If Engineer is ready: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, take control of Engineer. If you already control Engineer, discover 1 clue from your location instead. Any investigator at Engineer's location may trigger this action. Forced - When Engineer would be discarded: Instead, heal all damage and horror from it, lose control of it, and exhaust it.

name: Village Commons
text: Each investigator at Village Commons cannot take draw or resource actions. [action]: Resign. "This is suicide! We're better off hiding out the night."

name: Bishop's Brook
text: Forced - After you reveal Bishop's Brook: Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 2 damage. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Bishop's Brook. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Burned Ruins
text: Forced - After you successfully investigate Burned Ruins: Take 1 damage. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Burned Ruins. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Osborn's General Store
text: Forced - After you reveal Osborn's General Store: Gain 2 resources. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Osborn's General Store. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Congregational Church
text: Forced - After you reveal Congregational Church: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Kidnapped! and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Congregational Church. (Group limit once per game.)

name: House in the Reeds
text:
While you are in the House in the Reeds, you cannot play assets.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath House in the Reeds. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Schoolhouse
text: Forced - After you discover a clue from this location: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Servant of Many Mouths and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Schoolhouse. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Hired Gun
text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy (including Hired Gun) gains: "Hunter. Prey - Most resources." Each copy of Hunted Down gains peril and surge.

name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
text: Massive. Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula. Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth moves for the first time each round, if it is unengaged: It immediately moves again toward a random location.

name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
text:
Massive.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +2 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
text:
Massive. Retaliate.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
text: Massive. Retaliate. Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula. Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth enters your location, or vice versa: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

name: Imperceptible Creature
text: Surge. Revelation - Attach to a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy in play without a copy of Imperceptible Creature attached. Remove 1 clue from that enemy. Attached enemy gains [[Elite]].

name: Base of the Hill
text: Base of the Hill is connected to each copy of Diverging Path. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Base of the Hill: Spend those clues and put that many random set-aside Diverging Path locations into play. [action]: Resign. "This is more than I signed up for!"

name: Ascending Path
text: Ascending Path is connected to each copy of Altered Path. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Ascending Path: Spend those clues and put that many random set-aside Altered Path locations into play.

name: Abandoned Camp
text: Forced - After you reveal Abandoned Camp: Lose 2 resources for each action you have performed this round (including this one, if applicable).

name: Fathomless Lake
text: Forced - After you reveal Fathomless Lake: If you have 2 or more actions remaining, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

name: Naomi O'Bannion
text:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [combat].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a non-[auto_fail] chaos token during an [intellect] or [combat] test, exhaust Naomi O'Bannion: Cancel that chaos token and reveal a new chaos token. For the remainder of this test, if another copy of the canceled chaos token is revealed, cancel it and reveal a new chaos token.

name: Breaking Through (v. II)
text: Forced - After you are moved to a location by an encounter card effect: Take 1 horror.

name: Into the Beyond (v. II)
text: [action]: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose a location discarded by this effect and resolve its 'revelation' ability. Objective - If an investigator enters The Edge of the Universe, advance.

name: Seth Bishop
text: Retaliate. Forced - When Seth Bishop attacks you during the enemy phase: Either move to Another Dimension after this attack, or Seth Bishop deals +2 damage for this attack. Forced - After Yog-Sothoth enters Seth Bishop's location (or vice versa): Seth is devoured whole. Remove Seth Bishop from the game. Heal 6 damage from Yog-Sothoth.

name: Realms Beyond
text: Yog-Sothoth is immune to player card effects, cannot take damage, and cannot leave Realms Beyond. As an additional cost for you to leave Realms Beyond, test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Forced - When a forced effect would move an investigator or enemy to Another Dimension: Move them here instead. Cannot be canceled.

name: Indecipherable Stairs
text: Revelation - Put Indecipherable Stairs into play and discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Forced - After you leave Indecipherable Stairs: You must either take 2 horror, or discard Indecipherable Stairs.

name: Towering Luminosity
text: Revelation - Put Towering Luminosity into play and either place 1 doom on it or take 2 damage. Forced - After you fail a test while at this location: You must either flip 1 clue on Towering Luminosity to its doom side, or discard Towering Luminosity.

name: Unstable Vortex
text: Revelation - Put Unstable Vortex into play and discard 1 copy of Tear Through Space, if able. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at Unstable Vortex: You must either draw the top card of the encounter deck, or shuffle Unstable Vortex into the encounter deck.

name: Haunting Recollections
text: Revelation - For each card in your hand, if there is a copy of that card in your discard pile, take 1 horror (to a maximum of 3 horror). If you take no horror from this effect, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

name: A Baleful Welcome
text: Peril. Revelation - Choose two of the following actions (investigate, fight, evade, move, or play). For the remainder of the round, each investigator cannot perform each chosen action. If this is not the first copy of A Baleful Welcome drawn this phase, choose three of those actions instead.

name: Infinite Doorway
text: Revelation - Attach to your location. As an additional cost to move into or out of attached location, discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, for each copy of the discarded card in your hand or play area, you must either take 1 horror or discard that card.

name: Resurgent Evils
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Draw the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

name: Secret Door
text: Revelation - Attach to the location with the most investigators, and without a Secret Door attached. Investigators cannot leave this location. [action]: Test [willpower] (3) to search for the passage or [intellect] (3) to discern the way out. If you succeed, discard Secret Door.

name: Inexplicable Cold
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, you must either choose and discard 1 card from your play area or from your hand, or take 1 damage.

name: Oppressive Mists
text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Forced - After an investigator at this location draws 1 or more cards, that investigator must test [willpower] (3). If that investigator fails, he or she chooses and discards an equal number of cards. [action] [action]: Discard Oppressive Mists.

name: Violent Commands
text: Revelation - Put Violent Commands into play in your threat area. [action]: Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location and discard Violent Commands. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

name: Idle Hands
text: Revelation - Put Idle Hands into play in your threat area. [free] If Idle Hands is in your threat area, during your turn, take 2 damage and discard Idle Hands: You may take an additional action this turn. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror.

name: Need for Knowledge
text: Revelation - If you have no clues, Need for Knowledge gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (X), where X equals the number of clues you have (to a maximum of 5). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location.

name: Vassal of the Lurker
text: Hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Vassal of the Lurker's location discards 1 card from the top of his or her deck.

name: Eldritch Accord
text: Peril. Revelation - You may draw 1 card. You may choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand. Test [willpower] (X). If you fail, take 2 horror. X equals the number of cards in your hand when this test begins.

name: .32 Colt
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack. [free] Spend 1 resource: Return .32 Colt to your hand.

name: "Eat lead!"
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset. Spend 1 additional ammo token from that asset. When you reveal chaos tokens for this attack, reveal 1 additional chaos token. Choose one to resolve and ignore the other.

name: Logical Reasoning
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: For each clue you have (to a maximum of 3), either heal 2 horror from an investigator at your location or discard a [[Terror]] card at your location.

name: Archaic Glyphs
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Archaic Glyphs (Untranslated), and only if "you have translated the glyphs" in your Campaign Log. Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. If you succeed, you may put an asset with printed cost of X or lower into play from your hand. X is the amount you succeeded by.

name: Stealth
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [free] During your turn, exhaust Stealth: Evade. The chosen enemy gets -2 evade for this evasion attempt. If you successfully evade the enemy, disengage with it but do not exhaust it. Until the end of your turn, that enemy cannot engage you.

name: Suggestion
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Uses (3 charges). If Suggestion has no charges, discard it. [action] Exhaust Suggestion: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 charge from Suggestion.

name: Alchemical Transmutation
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
Uses (4 charges).
[action] Exhaust Alchemical Transmutation, spend 1 charge: Test [willpower] (0). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 4). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, take 1 damage.

name: Storm of Spirits
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack. If you succeed, instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 3 damage to each enemy at your location (any additional damage is dealt to the attacked enemy). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed during this attack, deal 2 damage to each investigator at your location.

name: Lantern
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. [action] Discard Lantern: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location (or remove Lantern from the game to deal 2 damage, instead). This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

name: Gravedigger's Shovel
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Gravedigger's Shovel: Discover 1 clue at your location (or remove Gravedigger's Shovel from the game to discover 2 clues, instead).

name: Unspeakable Oath (Bloodthirst)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy in excess of its remaining health: Discard this card from your hand.

name: Unspeakable Oath (Curiosity)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] After you successfully investigate a location with no clues on it: Discard this card from your hand.

name: Unspeakable Oath (Cowardice)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [action]: Evade. Use only on an exhausted unengaged enemy at your location. If you succeed, discard this card from your hand.

name: The Stranger
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.

name: The Stranger
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.

name: The Stranger
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Objective - When The Man in the Pallid Mask would be discarded from play, advance.

name: Theatre Lounge
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After you reveal the Theatre Lounge: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Search the encounter deck for the 2 topmost hidden cards and secretly add both of those cards to your hand. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Prop Shop
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: While you are investigating Prop Shop, it gets -1 shroud for each horror on you. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Prop Shop: Take 1 horror.

name: La Comtesse
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Spawn - Balcony. Hunter. Forced - After you defeat La Comtesse: Place her in your hand, as a hidden card. While La Comtesse is in your hand, she gains: "La Comtesse counts as 4 cards instead of 1 while checking your hand size. Forced - After you discard 1 or more cards from your hand during the upkeep phase: Take 1 horror."

name: Dianne Devine
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Prey - Most clues. Hunter. Dianne Devine gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After any investigator performs a parley action: Move Dianne Devine once toward that investigator.

name: Crazed Guest
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Hunter. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, you manage to get through to them for just a moment; automatically evade Crazed Guest. If you fail, your words fall on deaf ears.

name: Sickening Reality
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
If there are no Party Guests in play, place this card back underneath the scenario reference card and randomly choose a new Sickening Reality card to resolve. Otherwise, read the following:
A chorus of laughter erupts nearby as one of the guests dances to the bizarre music. You head over to discover what is so funny, but what you find is no laughing matter at all. The guest’s dance partner lies sprawled on the floor, limp and bloodied, a gaping, gory hole in their chest. The guest turns to you with a disturbing look in their eye and a wicked grin spreading on their lips.
Choose a Party Guest in play. Each investigator at that Party Guest's location takes 1 damage. Place 1 doom on the current agenda. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the chosen version of Party Guest, removing that version from the game.

name: Dianne Devine
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Each investigator at Dianne Devine's location cannot discover or take control of clues. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: Find the [[Bystander]] asset with the fewest clues on it (among [[Bystander]] assets with at least one clue). Move Dianne Devine to that asset's location, if able.

name: Party Guest
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Find the [[Bystander]] asset with the most clues on it, and put Party Guest into play at that asset's location. Investigators cannot parley with [[Bystander]] assets at Party Guest's location. [action] Spend 2 resources: Parley. Move Party Guest to a connecting location.

name: Shocking Display
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Randomly resolve one of the Sickening Reality cards underneath the scenario reference card. Cannot be canceled.

name: Quiet Halls
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Entry Hall is connected to Quiet Halls. Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Basement]] location. [action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls (from the token bank).

name: Historical Society
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: While you have at least 1 hidden card in your hand, you cannot investigate this location.

name: Historical Society
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - When you investigate this location, if there is at least 1 [[Cultist]] enemy in play: This location gets -3 shroud for this investigation. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, move 1 clue from this location to the [[Cultist]] enemy farthest from you (before resolving the effects of the test).

name: Historical Society
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues at this location: One at a time, draw that many cards from the top of the encounter deck.

name: Keeper of the Oath
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: While the number of the current act is greater than the number of the current agenda, Keeper of the Oath gains hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Find each investigator whose location shares a [[Trait]] with Keeper of the Oath's location. Move 1 clue from each of those investigators to Keeper of the Oath.

name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. III)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)

name: "The Really Bad Ones" (v. IV)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Ignore the text on the unrevealed side of [[Arkham Asylum]] locations. Objective - Find the Patient Confinement location with Daniel Chesterfield. (You will be instructed when to advance.)

name: Host of Insanity
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Massive. Hunter. Host of Insanity gets +2 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you control Clasp of Black Onyx: Parley. You reveal the clasp to the creature. It freezes in place, whispering a garbled prayer. Automatically evade Host of Insanity.

name: Radical Treatment
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - At the end of the round: Daniel Chesterfield's controller takes 2 horror. [action] If you are at Infirmary: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, detach Radical Treatment and add it to the victory display. If you control Clasp of Black Onyx, reduce the difficulty of this test by 3.

name: Clouded Memory
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Forget something an investigator has "remembered" from an ability on a location. (It is no longer true.) - Take 1 horror and Clouded Memory gains surge.

name: Montparnasse
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After you discover any number of clues from Montparnasse: Discard cards from your hand with that many [willpower] icons among them. If you cannot, take 1 horror.

name: Grand Guignol
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action] Spend 5 resources: Either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or remove 1 doom from the current agenda. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After an enemy moves into Père Lachaise Cemetery: It gets +1 horror value for the remainder of the round.

name: Canal Saint-Martin
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: While you are at Canal Saint-Martin, you must use your [combat] in place of your [agility], and vice versa.

name: Notre-Dame
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
Each enemy at Notre-Dame gets +1 fight and -1 evade.
[reaction] After you successfully evade an enemy at Notre-Dame by 3 or more during your turn: You may take an additional action this turn. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Gardens of Luxembourg
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After you enter Gardens of Luxembourg, if there is at least 1 [[Byakhee]] enemy in play: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, each [[Byakhee]] enemy in play readies and moves to Gardens of Luxembourg.

name: Figure in the Shadows
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Check Campaign Log. - If you have more (or equal) Doubt than Conviction, move The Organist 1 location away from the nearest investigator (to a location with no investigators, if possible). - If you have more Conviction than Doubt, resolve The Organist's hunter keyword.

name: Secret Passage
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action] If you control Clasp of Black Onyx: You place the clasp within the skull's eye socket, and the passage opens. Reveal the Catacombs location to the right of Secret Passage. Forced - When Secret Passage is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play to the right of Secret Passage.

name: Mound of Bones
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - When Mound of Bones is revealed: Put the top 4 Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, to the left, and to the right of Mound of Bones. At the end of the current round, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Malformed Skeleton and spawn it at Mound of Bones.

name: Research Site
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Research Site: Reveal any Catacombs location. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - When Research Site is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, or to the right of any other location.

name: Sea of Skulls
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Sea of Skulls: You must either take 1 direct horror or choose and discard 3 cards from your hand. Forced - When Sea of Skulls is revealed: Put the topmost Catacombs in the Catacombs deck into play above, below, or to the right of the location farthest from Sea of Skulls and mark it with a horror token. For the remainder of the game, Sea of Skulls is connected to the marked location.

name: Malformed Skeleton
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Hunter. Forced - When Malformed Skeleton would resolve its hunter keyword: If there are no investigators within 2 locations of Malformed Skeleton, instead of resolving its hunter keyword, move it to the Catacombs location nearest to an investigator. Forced - When Malformed Skeleton attacks you: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.

name: Cloister
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action] If there are no clues on Cloister: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, remember that you have "found the tower key."

name: Knight's Hall
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: [action] If there are no clues on Knight's Hall: Test [combat] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a guide."

name: Hastur's Gaze
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Hastur's Gaze to your hand. Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "c" agenda: Take 2 horror and discard Hastur's Gaze from your hand.

name: Hastur's Grasp
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Hastur's Grasp to your hand. Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "a" agenda: Take 2 damage and discard Hastur's Grasp from your hand.

name: Palace of the King
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Palace of the King cannot be flipped over while Hastur has more than 2 [per_investigator] remaining health.

name: Recesses of Your Own Mind
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
While you are in the Recesses of Your Own Mind, set the base value of your [willpower] to 0.
Each investigator at Recesses of Your Own Mind is considered to be at a different copy of Recesses of Your Own Mind for the purposes of player card effects and committing cards to each other's skill tests.

name: The Throne Room
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
Hastur cannot leave The Throne Room.
Hastur cannot be exhausted.
Hastur cannot make attacks of opportunity.

name: Stage of the Ward Theatre
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
While Hastur is moving, if there is an investigator at Stage of the Ward Theatre, Hastur's location is considered to be connected to Stage of the Ward Theatre.
While you are at Stage of the Ward Theatre, you cannot attack Hastur.

name: High Priest of Hastur
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Spawn - Palace of the King. Prey - Most cards in hand. Hunter. Forced - When High Priest of Hastur attacks you, if you have a copy of Possession in your hand: Reveal it. The high priest welcomes you into the grand company of the King. You are eliminated and driven insane.

name: Delusory Evils
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - You must either secretly add Delusory Evils to your hand, or place 1 doom on the current agenda and discard Delusory Evils (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance). Forced - When you would succeed at a skill test by 3 or more: You automatically fail, instead. Discard Delusory Evils from your hand.

name: Bleeding Walls
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, lose 1 action and take 1 horror.

name: Fragile Thoughts
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Discard events from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of your location. If no cards are discarded by this effect, Fragile Thoughts gains surge.

name: Maggot Swarm
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text:
Maggot Swarm's location gets +2 shroud.
While Maggot Swarm is at a location with no clues, it gains hunter.

name: Preying Byakhee
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity only. Hunter. While engaged with an investigator with remaining sanity 4 or fewer, swap Preying Byakhee's fight and evade values.

name: The Sign of Hastur
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Revelation - Attach The Sign of Hastur to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. Forced - Each time an investigator takes 1 or more horror: He or she takes 1 additional horror.

name: Visions in Your Mind (Horrors)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 play action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

name: Visions in Your Mind (Failure)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 resource action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

name: Visions in Your Mind (Death)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 move action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

name: Visions in Your Mind (Hatred)
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When your turn ends, if you did not perform at least 1 draw action during your turn: Discard this card from your hand and take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

name: Maddening Delusions
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Surge. Revelation - If you have 1 or more hidden cards in your hand, take 1 horror.

name: Voice of Tru'nembra
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must choose a different option: - Lose 2 resources. - Take 1 horror. - Get -2 to the next skill test you perform this round.

name: Melancholy
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Put Melancholy into play in your threat area. Increase the resource cost of each card in your hand by 1. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Melancholy.

name: Painful Reflection
pack_name: Return to the Path to Carcosa
text: Revelation - Put Painful Reflection into play in your threat area. Forced - When you play an event: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token, cancel that event, take 1 horror, and discard Painful Reflection.

name: Blood Eclipse
text: As an additional cost to play Blood Eclipse, take 2 damage. Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] and deal +2 damage for this attack.

name: Survival Knife
text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [reaction] When an enemy attacks you during the enemy phase (before resolving that attack), exhaust Survival Knife: Fight. This attack targets the attacking enemy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.

name: Truth from Fiction
text: Place 2 secrets among assets controlled by investigators at your location (3 secrets instead if there is a clue at your location).

name: Ancient Stone
text: You can only include this asset in your deck by upgrading it from Ancient Stone (Unidentified), and only if "you have identified the stone" in your Campaign Log. Uses (X secrets). X is the number in parentheses next to "you have identified the stone." [reaction] When you draw any number of cards, spend that many secrets: Move that many times.

name: Decorated Skull
text: Uses (0 charges). [reaction] After an investigator, [[Ally]] asset, or enemy at your location is defeated: Place 1 resource (from the token bank) on Decorated Skull, as a charge. [action] Spend up to 3 charges: Draw that many cards and gain that many resources.

name: Colt Vest Pocket
text: Uses (5 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round, if you triggered Colt Vest Pocket's "[action]" ability: Discard it.

name: Mists of R'lyeh
text: Uses (5 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. You get +1 [willpower] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, after evading the chosen enemy, you may move to a connecting location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, choose and discard a card from your hand.

name: The Chthonian Stone
text: Seal ([skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing]). Uses (3 charges). If The Chthonian Stone has no charges, return it to your hand. Forced - After you reveal an [auto_fail] symbol during a skill test: Remove 1 charge from The Chthonian Stone.

name: Alter Fate
text: Choose and discard from play a non-weakness treachery that is not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy.

name: On Your Own
text: Exceptional. Permanent. Your investigator gains: "Deckbuilding Restrictions: No assets that take up an ally slot." [reaction] When you play a [survivor] event, exhaust On Your Own: Reduce that event's cost by 2.

name: Backpack
text:
[reaction] After Backpack enters play: Search the top 12 cards of your deck for up to 3 non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Supply]] cards, and attach them facedown to Backpack. Shuffle your deck.
Cards attached to Backpack may be played as if they were in your hand. If there are no cards attached to Backpack, discard it.

name: Dendromorphosis
text: Revelation - Put Dendromorphosis into play in your threat area. It cannot leave play while it has no damage on it. [fast] Take 1 direct damage: Deal 1 damage to Dendromorphosis. Card design by the Botanists at Arkham Nights 2018.

name: Offer You Cannot Refuse
text: Campaign Mode only. When you become the bearer of this weakness, gain 2 experience. Revelation - Lose 5 resources. If you cannot, instead remove Offer You Cannot Refuse from your deck, search the collection for Fine Print, and place it in your discard pile.

name: Fine Print
text: Revelation - Lose 7 resources. If you cannot, instead remove Fine Print from your deck, search the collection for Sell Your Soul, and place it in your discard pile.

name: Sell Your Soul
text: Revelation - Lose 10 resources. If you cannot, your dark patron tears your consciousness from your body. You are driven insane.

name: Harbinger of Valusia
text: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. While this enemy has 5 [per_investigator] or more damage on it, it gets +2 fight and -2 evade. Forced - After a successful attack or evasion attempt against this enemy ends: Place 1 resource on it. Then, if there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on it, it vanishes with a sinister hiss. (Set it aside, out of play. It keeps all damage tokens.)

name: Entryway
text: [action]: Resign. You've escaped... for now. [action]: Check your supplies. If you have torches: Look at the top 2 cards of the exploration deck. Discard 1 treachery or enemy looked at by this effect. Shuffle the exploration deck. This ability can be used at any location.

name: Sealed Passage
text: [action] Check your supplies. If you have the Key of Eztli: Search the exploration deck and all set-aside cards for Chamber of Time and put it into play. If it is act 1a, skip directly to act 2a. For the remainder of this act, Sealed Passage is connected to Chamber of Time and vice versa. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Mosaic Chamber
text: [action] Check your supplies. If you have a canteen: The chamber accepts your gift of water. Remove 1 doom from any location in play. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Tomb of the Ancients
text: [action] Check your supplies. If an investigator at Tomb of the Ancients has rope: Move to a revealed location up to 3 connections away. Until the end of the round, Tomb of the Ancients is considered to be connected to that location, and vice versa. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Throne Room
text:
While Throne Room has doom on it, it is considered to be in the victory display (for the purposes of counting vengeance).
[action] If there are no clues or doom on Throne Room: Record "mysterious scepter" in your supplies. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Snake Pit
text: Forced - After you put Snake Pit into play by exploring successfully, but before moving to it: Spawn 1 [per_investigator] set-aside Pit Viper enemies in Snake Pit (to a maximum of 3). Check your supplies. If an investigator at your location has binoculars, you may choose not to move to Snake Pit. Otherwise, you must move to it.

name: Ancient Hall
text:
Ancient Hall enters play with 1 [per_investigator] doom on it.
[action]: Flip 1 doom on Ancient Hall to its clue side.
[fast]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, flip 1 doom on Ancient Hall to its clue side. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Grand Chamber
text: [action] Check your supplies. If you have a map and there are no clues on Grand Chamber: For the remainder of the scenario (and its resolution), Grand Chamber loses Vengeance 1 and gains Victory 1. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Chamber of Time
text: Forced - After Chamber of Time enters play: Attach the set-aside Relic of Ages asset to the Chamber of Time. Place 1 doom on Chamber of Time.

name: Search for the Meaning
text: Objective - Only investigators in Rivertown can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

name: The Hastings Estates
text: Revelation - Put The Hastings Estate into play. [action] Cross medicine off from your supplies: Discover all of the clues on The Hastings Estate.

name: Search for the Source
text: Objective - Only investigators in Northside can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

name: Merle Garvin
text: Revelation - Put Merle Garvin into play at Miskatonic University. [action]: Parley. Mr. Garvin tries to give you the slip. Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, place 1 clue on Merle Garvin (from the token pool) and move him 1 location away from you. If you fail, move him 2 locations away from you.

name: The Overgrown Estate
text: Objective - Only investigators at The Hastings Estate can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

name: The Overgrown Estate
text: Objective - Only investigators at The Hastings Estate can spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

name: Clinton Freeman
text: Revelation - Put Clinton Freeman into play at Velma's Diner. Advance to Act 3g - "Discover the Truth." [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 clue on Clinton Freeman (from the token pool) and take 1 horror. If you fail, take 1 horror for each point you failed by.

name: Seeking Trouble
text: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Merle Garvin: You must remove them and immediately advance.

name: Seeking Trouble
text: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Merle Garvin: You must remove them and immediately advance.

name: Loading Docks
text: Revelation - Put Loading Docks into play with 4 resources on it. Advance to Act 3g - "Discover the Truth." While there are no resources on Loading Docks, clues on it cannot be discovered by any means. Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 resource from Loading Docks.

name: Discover the Truth
text: Objective - If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Clinton Freeman: You must remove them and immediately advance. Objective - If Loading Docks is in play and there are no clues remaining on it: You must immediately advance.

name: Impossible Pursuit
text: Objective - If the Harbinger of Valusia leaves play, advance.

name: Veda Whitsley
text: [fast] Exhaust Veda Whitsley: Look at the top card of the exploration deck or encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may deal 1 damage to Veda Whitsley to discard it. If it is a treachery, you may deal 1 horror to Veda Whitsley to discard it. Otherwise, return it to the top of its deck.

name: Temple Ruins
text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate Temple Ruins: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: Metropolitan Cathedral
text: [action] Take 1 horror: Gain 2 resources. [action] If you have 10 or more resources: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: Chapultepec Park
text: Forced - After you fail an [agility] test while at Chapultepec Park: Take 1 damage. [action]: Explore. Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: Zócalo
text: [action] Discard cards with a combined total of at least 4 skill icons from your hand: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: Xochimilco
text: [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an enemy at Xochimilco: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: Coyoacán
text: While you are at Coyoacán, damage/horror cannot be healed from cards you control. [action] If you have 5 or more total damage and/or horror on your investigator: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a location with a matching location symbol in the upper-left corner, place it on top of this location, taking its place.

name: A Familiar Pattern
text: Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.

name: The Winged Serpent
text: Spawn - Mouth of K'n-yan. Hunter. Massive. Cannot be defeated. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced - If there are 5 or more damage on this enemy, or after a pillar token is placed on the Mouth of K'n-yan: Heal all damage from this enemy and exhaust it. It does not ready during the upkeep phase this round.

name: Feathered Serpent
text: X is the number of pillar tokens on Mouth of K'n-yan. While X is 3 or higher, Feathered Serpent gains alert and hunter. [action]: Evade. Check your supplies. If you have a mysterious scepter, you automatically evade the serpent and command it to deal its damage to another enemy at its location.

name: Ruins of K'n-yan
text: [action] [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a compass, discover 2 clues on Ruins of K'n-yan. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Subterranean Swamp
text: [fast] If there are no clues on Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you have a canteen, place 1 doom on this location and record "sticky goop" in your supplies. (Group limit once per game.) Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Subterranean Swamp: Check your supplies. If you do not have a pocketknife, lose all remaining actions and end your turn.

name: Chthonian Depths
text: Forced - After the last clue is discovered from Chthonian Depths: Check your supplies. If no investigator at this location has torches, place 1 doom on it.

name: Treacherous Descent
text: [action]: Check your supplies. If you have a pickaxe, reduce the shroud value of Treacherous Descent by 2 for the remainder of the scenario. (Group limit 3 times per game.)

name: Unrestricted Access
text: Objective - If three of the following are true, you must advance: - An investigator "found the process." - An investigator "dissected an organ." - An investigator "interviewed a subject." - An investigator "realized what year it is." - An investigator "activated the device." - An investigator controls The Custodian. - An investigator "read about Earth." - An investigator "saw a familiar specimen."

name: Halls of Pnakotus
text: This location is connected to Halls of Pnakotus (Eastern Corridors) and Halls of Pnakotus (Western Corridors), and vice versa. [free] During your turn, choose and discard a card from your hand: Move to another copy of Halls of Pnakotus. (Limit once per turn.)

name: Cyclopean Vaults
text:
[action]: Discard each non-weakness card in your hand.
[action] If you have no cards in your hand: Remember that you "read about Earth."
[action] [action] If you have fewer than 5 cards in your hand: Draw cards until you have exactly 5 cards in your hand.

name: Alien Conservatory
text:
While you are in the Alien Conservatory, decrease your maximum hand size by 2.
[action]: Test [willpower] (1). If you succeed, test [agility] (2). If you succeed, test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remember that you "saw a familiar specimen."

name: Captive Subjects
text: Spawn - Alien Conservatory. Aloof. Retaliate. If an investigator "read about Earth" or "saw a familiar specimen," Captive Subjects loses aloof and gains hunter.

name: Perils of Yoth
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play. (This exploration fails.) - Set Perils of Yoth aside, out of play: take horror or damage equal to the current depth level; and continue exploring as if you had not drawn Perils of Yoth.

name: Great Hall of Celeano
text: [reaction] After you move to Great Hall of Celeano, place 1 doom on it: Look at the top card of the encounter deck, the exploration deck, or any player deck. You may discard that card.

name: Buenos Aires
text: Buenos Aires gets -2 shroud for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Buenos Aires.

name: Ultima Thule
text: Forced - After Ultima Thule enters play: Search the chaos bag for the [elder_sign] chaos token and seal it on Ultima Thule.

name: Unknowable Past
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Reveal 4 chaos tokens. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - Choose and discard 1 card from your hand and shuffle Unknowable Past into the exploration deck. You cannot choose this option if Unknowable Past was drawn from the exploration deck.

name: Riverside Temple
text: Forced - After any number of clues are discovered at Riverside Temple: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Riverside Temple has chalk, shuffle an equal number of cards from the top of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.

name: Waterfall
text: [reaction] When you investigate Waterfall: Check your supplies. If an investigator at Waterfall has rope, reduce Waterfall's shroud by 3 for this investigation. Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating Waterfall: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

name: Trail of the Dead
text: Forced - After you investigate or explore while at Trail of the Dead: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Trail of the Dead has binoculars, take 1 horror.

name: Cloud Forest
text: Forced - When an enemy at Cloud Forest would be dealt any amount of damage: Check your supplies. If no investigator at Cloud Forest has torches, cancel that damage.

name: Brotherhood Acolyte
text: Spawn - Location with the most [[Cultist]] enemies. Aloof. Forced - After Brotherhood Acolyte enters plaay: Place 1 doom on each other [[Cultist]] enemy at its location.

name: Stolen Mind
text: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Stolen Mind gets +1 fight for each doom on it. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Stolen Mind.

name: From Another Time
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). Place X doom on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, divided as evenly as possible. X is the amount you failed by. If you fail and there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, instead search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).

name: Resentful Wilds
text: Revelation - Take 1 horror and attach Resentful Wilds to the nearest location without a copy of Resentful Wilds attached. Forced - After you successfully explore at attached location: Add Resentful Wilds to the victory display.

name: Best-Laid Plans
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Lose 2 actions. - Shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the exploration deck.

name: Merging Timelines
text: Revelation - Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. For each card in your hand that matches one of the cards (by title), discard that card from your hand and lose 1 action. Shuffle each weakness discarded by this effect into your deck.

name: Tindalos Alpha
text: Alert. Retaliate. Forced - After Tindalos Alpha attacks you: Shuffle a non-story asset you control into your deck, moving all damage and horror from that asset to your investigator. Discard Tindalos Alpha. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Discard Tindalos Alpha.

name: Vengeful Serpent
text: Hunter. Forced - After you draw Vengeful Serpent: Draw each Vengeful Serpent in the victory display as well.

name: Serpent Guardian
text: Spawn - Nearest location with at least 1 clue. Aloof. While Serpent Guardian is unengaged, its location gets +2 shroud. While there are 3 or more vengeance points in the victory display, Serpent Guardian loses aloof and gains hunter.

name: Wrath of Yig
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each vengeance point in the victory display. If you fail, put a set-aside Poisoned weakness into play in your threat area (if you cannot, take 2 damage).

name: The Star • XVII
text:
Each asset you control with health gets +1 health.
Each asset you control with sanity gets +1 sanity.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Star • XVII is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

name: Hallowed Mirror
text: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Soothing Melody: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Hallowed Mirror enter play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

name: The World • XXI
text:
[fast] If you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust The World • XXI: Draw 1 card.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The World • XXI is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

name: Occult Lexicon
text: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Blood-Rite: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

name: Knight of Swords
text:
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test: You get +1 skill value for this test. You may discard Knight of Swords to get +3 instead.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Knight of Swords is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

name: Well Connected
text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] Exhaust Well Connected: You get +1 skill value for this skill test for every 4 resources you have.
[fast] Spend 2 resources: Ready Well Connected. (Limit once per round.)

name: The Hierophant • V
text:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up accessory slots, and vice versa.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Hierophant • V is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

name: Sign Magick
text: Fast. You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset. [reaction] After you activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset, exhaust Sign Magick: Activate an [action] ability on a different [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control (without paying its [action] cost).

name: Nine of Rods
text:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness encounter card, exhaust Nine of Rods: Cancel all of that card's effects and shuffle it into the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Nine of Rods is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

name: Trial by Fire
text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, set the base value of each of your skills to 5, or the base value of one of your skills to 7.

name: The Fool • 0
text:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Fool • 0: Reduce that card's cost by 1.

name: Neither Rain nor Snow
text:
Stella Clark deck only.
If this skill test fails, cancel all effects of the failed test.

name: Called by the Mists
text: Revelation - Put Called by the Mists into play in your threat area. Forced - After you initiate a skill test with a difficulty of 4 or higher: Take 1 damage. [action] [action]: Discard Called by the Mists.

name: Atychiphobia
text: Revelation - Put Atychiphobia into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test: Take 1 horror. [action] [action]: Discard Atychiphobia.

name: .18 Derringer
text: Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer.

name: Grimm's Fairy Tales
text:
Uses (4 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location fails a skill test by 2 or more, exhaust Grimm's Fairy Tales and spend 1 secret: Heal 1 horror from that investigator.

name: Old Keyring
text: Uses (2 keys). If there are no keys on Old Keyring, discard it. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, remove 1 key from Old Keyring.

name: Granny Orne
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator fails by either 1 less or 1 more.

name: Mysterious Raven
text: [fast] Discard Mysterious Raven and take 1 horror: Discover 1 clue at your location.

name: Rabbit's Foot
text: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.

name: Scrapper
text:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.

name: Will to Survive
text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Do not reveal chaos tokens for the next skill test you perform this turn.

name: A Test of Will
text:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, cancel that card's revelation effect.

name: Dumb Luck
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on top of the encounter deck.

name: Grit Your Teeth
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test.
You get +1 to each of your skills for the remainder of the round.

name: Live and Learn
text: Fast. Play after a skill test you failed ends (after resolving all effects from the failed test). Attempt that test again. You get +2 skill value for this test.

name: "Look what I found!"
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.

name: Oops!
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while attacking an enemy engaged with you.
Deal this attack's damage to a different enemy at your location.

name: Take Heart
text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Take Heart to any type of test.
If this test fails, the performing investigator draws 2 cards and gains 2 resources.

name: Cherished Keepsake
text: Forced - When Cherished Keepsake is defeated by horror: Exile it.

name: Leather Coat
text: Forced - When Leather Coat is defeated by damage: Exile it.

name: .18 Derringer
text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you fail, place 1 ammo on .18 Derringer and the next time you trigger this ability this round, you get an additional +1 [combat] for that attack.

name: A Test of Will
text:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, test [willpower] (3). If you fail, exile A Test of Will.

name: "Look what I found!"
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.

name: Dumb Luck
text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 3 or less during an evasion attempt against a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Place that enemy on the bottom of the encounter deck.

name: Unexpected Courage
text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test fails, return Unexpected Courage to your hand.

name: Granny Orne
text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 [intellect].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, exhaust Granny Orne: That investigator either gets +1 skill value or -1 skill value for that test.

name: Lucky!
text:
Fast. Play when an investigator at your location would fail a skill test.
They get +3 to their skill value for that test. That investigator draws 1 card.

name: Chainsaw
text: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If this attack fails, either place 1 supply on Chainsaw or deal 1 damage to the attacked enemy.

name: Quick Learner
text:
Permanent.
During or before your first action of each of your turns, each skill test you perform gets +1 difficulty.
During or after your third action of each of your turns, each skill test you performed gets -1 difficulty.

name: Déjà Vu
text:
Permanent.
In between two scenarios of a campaign, reduce the experience cost to repurchase up to 3 cards that you exiled during the last scenario by 1 each.

name: Awakening
text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there is at least 1 doom on this agenda and no group has yet triggered this ability: The lead investigator of Group A chooses a random set-aside [[Act 1]] story card and draws it. Announce the chosen card's title to all three groups. Each other lead investigator draws that story card.

name: Agony and Despair
text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there is at least 1 doom on this agenda and no group has yet triggered this ability: The lead investigator of Group A chooses a random set-aside [[Act 2]] story card and draws it. Announce the chosen card's title to all three groups. Each other lead investigator draws that story card.

name: The Mastermind
text: Each [[distortion]] location gains: "[action] [survivor]4+1< T %2[cultist]+: <+@2 H <@6@~+ [willpower]9 EIXODOLON. (Group limit once per game.)" Objective - If each investigator is defeated, advance this agenda.

name: Sealed In (Group A)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. By the time the agenda advances, investigators must possess the Key of Mysteries and the requisite number of clues. (Beware - If the agenda advanced and you do not meet this condition, each investigator in this group will be killed.)

name: Watery Grave (Group B)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. By the time the agenda advances, investigators at the same location must possess the requisite number of clues. (Beware - If the agenda advances and you do not meet this condition, the investigator in the Chamber of Rain will be killed.)

name: The Levers (Group C)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. Before the agenda advances, one investigator must activate the [action] ability on the Chamber of Regret. (Beware - If you pull the wrong lever, you will be killed.)

name: The Levers (Group C)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. Before the agenda advances, one investigator must activate the [action] ability on the Chamber of Regret. Beware - If you pull the wrong lever, you will be killed

name: Distortions in Time (Group A)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. When the agenda advances, there must be at least 11 doom in play. (Beware - If the agenda advances and you do not meet this condition, each investigator in this group will be killed.)

name: Seeping Death (Group B)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. Before the agenda advances, one investigator must activate the [action] ability on the Chamber of Poison.

name: The Pet (Group C)
text: Timed - Do not advance this act until you are instructed. Find a way to deal with Eixodolon's Pet before the agenda advances. (Beware - If the creature is still “locked away” when the agenda advances, it will break free.)

name: The Escape
text: Objective - At the end of the round, if Eixodolon has no remaining health, you may move any damage on him in excess of his health to another group's copy of Eixodolon. Then, advance.

name: The Escape
text: Objective - If Eixodolon has no remaining health, advance.

name: Chamber of Secrets
text: [action]: You pound your fists on the wall of the chamber. Nobody responds.

name: Chamber of Secrets
text: [action]: You pound your fists on the wall of the chamber. Nobody responds.

name: Chamber of Secrets
text: [action]: You pound your fists on the wall of the chamber. Nobody responds.

name: Chamber of Rain
text: The Chamber of Rain is sealed shut while the water flows. While it is Act 1, this location gains: “Investigators cannot move into or out of this location. Forced - When an investigator here draws an enemy card: Discard it and draw a new card to replace it.”

name: Chamber of Sorrows
text: [action]: Test [combat] (1) to try to break down the door to the flooding terrarium. Regardless of whether you succeed or fail, it does not budge. Remember that you “tried your best.”

name: Chamber of Sorrows
text: [action]: Test [willpower] (2) to interpret the diagram inscribed on the glass. If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on an investigator in either Chamber of Sorrows or Chamber of Rain (or from that location if you are the only investigator in the game). Any investigator in either Chamber of Sorrows or Chamber of Rain may perform this action.

name: Chamber of Night
text: [action]: You call out for help as loud as you can. Nobody responds.

name: Chamber of Night
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, you notice strange writing inscribed along the wall; look at the revealed side of the location underneath the scenario reference card. When you are satisfied, place it back underneath the scenario reference card.

name: Chamber of Regret
text:
No more than one investigator may be in the Chamber of Regret at a time.
[action] The investigators spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You pull one of the 3 levers (choose one): left, middle, or right. As soon as you do, the gate slams shut behind you. You cannot leave the Chamber of Regret for the remainder of the current act.

name: Labyrinthine Halls
text: [free] Choose and discard 2 cards from your hand: You find an old lockbox in a pile of refuse, and decide to leave something behind. At the end of the round, choose another investigator in any group. That investigator draws 2 cards. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Labyrinthine Halls
text: [free] Spend 4 resources: You find the corpse of someone you think you once knew, and wish you could have saved them. At the end of the round, choose another investigator in any group. That investigator gains 4 resources. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Labyrinthine Halls
text: [action] [action]: You peer through an overgrown mirror and see an unfamiliar reflection. At the end of the round, choose another investigator in any group. That investigator may take 2 additional actions during his or her next turn. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Chamber of Hunger
text: [free] If there are no clues on Chamber of Hunger: There is something strange drawn on the glass. Take control of the set-aside Hunger Diagram.

name: Chamber of Decay
text: [free] If there are no clues on Chamber of Decay: There's a journal here with some strange scribblings. Take control of the set-aside Decay Diagram.

name: Chamber of Rot
text: [free] If there are no clues on Chamber of Rot: There is something strange etched on the walls. Take control of the set-aside Rot Diagram.

name: Chamber of Poison
text: [action]: You cross the noxious pit and turn the valve at the end. (Beware - activating this ability without the antidote may be deadly.)

name: Eixodolon's Note
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Eixolodon's Note to another investigator.

name: Key of Mysteries
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Place Key of Mysteries at your location. While the Key of Mysteries is uncontrolled, it gains: “[action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, take control of the Key of Mysteries.”

name: Mysterious Syringe
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Mysterious Syringe to another investigator. [action]: Choose an investigator at your location and remove Mysterious Syringe from the game. Remember that the chosen investigator has “been injected”

name: Rot Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Rot Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Decay, it gains: “[action]: Place 1 doom here. Flip any number of your clues to their doom side and place them here.”

name: Rot Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Rot Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Rot, it gains: “[action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, take control of the set-aside Mysterious Syringe.”

name: Hunger Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Hunger Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Rot, it gains: “[action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, take control of the set-aside Mysterious Syringe.”

name: Hunger Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Hunger Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Hunger, it gains: “[action] If Eixodolon's Pet is 'locked away,' spend 1 clue: Deal 4 damage to Eixodolon's Pet.”

name: Decay Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Decay Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Hunger, it gains: “[action] If Eixodolon's Pet is 'locked away,' spend 1 clue: Deal 4 damage to Eixodolon's Pet.”

name: Decay Diagram
text: Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Decay Diagram to another investigator. While you are in the Chamber of Decay, it gains: “[action]: Place 1 doom here. Flip any number of your clues to their doom side and place them here.”

name: Eixodolon
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Eixodolon gets +6 [per_investigator] health and cannot be defeated by damage. Forced - When the enemy phase begins, if there is a copy of Harvested Pain in the victory display: Ready Eixodolon.

name: Eixodolon's Pet
text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
While Eixodolon's Pet is “locked away,” it is immune to player card effects and Chamber of Hunger gains: “[action] Investigators at Chamber of Hunger spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Set Eixodolon's Pet aside, out of play. Remember that you “sent Eixodolon's Pet to another group.”

name: Eixodolon's Pet
text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
While Eixodolon's Pet is “locked away,” it is immune to player card effects.

name: The Jailor
text: Spawn - Nearest Labyrinthine Halls. Hunter. Eixodolon's Note gains: “[action] Fight. Use only on The Jailor. Use either [willpower] or [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, set The Jailor aside, out of play. At the end of the round, move The Jailor to another group's Labyrinthine Halls (it keeps all tokens and attachments).”

name: Faceless Abductor
text: Spawn - Nearest [[Prison]] location. Hunter. Forced - After Faceless Abductor attacks an investigator: Move that investigator to a [[Prison]] location.

name: Tortured Victim
text: Revelation - You must either discard a random card from your hand, or Tortured Victim makes an immediate attack against you.

name: Mi-Go Guard
text: Prey - Most remaining health. For each [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token revealed during an attack against Mi-Go Guard, that attack deals 1 fewer damage.

name: Unnatural Weariness
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must choose a different option: - Lose 3 resources. - Lose 1 action. - Discard a random card from your hand.

name: Poisonous Gas
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, lose 1 action (2 actions instead if you fail by 2 or more). When this skill test begins, an investigator at your location may place 1 of his or her clues on your location to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2.

name: Dreadful Mechanism
text: Revelation - Put Dreadful Mechanism into play in your threat area. Forced - After you perform an action other than the [action] ability below: Take 1 damage, discard an asset taking up at least 1 hand slot, and discard Dreadful Mechanism. [action]: Test [combat] (2). If you succeed, discard Dreadful Mechanism.

name: Blood and Rust
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 1 damage (2 damage instead if you fail by 2 or more). When this skill test begins, an investigator at your location may place 1 of his or her clues on your location to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2.

name: Paradox Effect
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. If you succeed, put Paradox Effect into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Paradox Effect and choose an investigator in another group. You and that investigator may talk in private and may exchange resources, story assets, and cards in hand.

name: Paradox Effect
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

name: Harvested Pain
text: Peril. Revelation - If you have 3 or fewer remaining health or sanity, add Harvested Pain to the victory display. Otherwise, take 1 damage and 1 horror. While Harvested Pain is in the victory display, Eixodolon gets +1 fight.

name: The Curse Spreads
text: Forced - At the end of the investigation phase, if The Rougarou is not engaged with an investigator: Add 1 doom to this agenda.

name: Finding Lady Esprit
text: Objective - Only investigators at a [[Bayou]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

name: Hunting the Rougarou
text: Forced - After The Rougarou leaves a location: Place 1 clue from the token bank on that location. Objective - "We have to destroy the beast!" If The Rougarou is defeated: (→R2) Objective - "Maybe there's another way..." While an investigator is engaged with The Rougarou, he or she may choose to advance. (Limit once per phase.)

name: Cursed Shores
text: [action]: Take 1 damage. You get +2 to your skill value for the next skill test you make this turn. Forced - When you leave Cursed Shores: Choose and discard a skill card from your hand.

name: Garden District
text: [action]: Test [agility] (7) to try to break into a nearby greenhouse and take a look around. If you succeed, remember that the investigators have "found a strange doll."

name: Broadmoor
text: [action]: Resign. "We can't catch the beast!" You make your way to safety, letting the beast roam free.

name: Brackish Waters
text:
While you are at Brackish Waters, you cannot play assets.
[action] Discard 2 assets from your hand or from play: Test [agility] (3) to wade through the dark waters and retrieve an abandoned fishing net. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Fishing Net asset.

name: Fauborg Marigny
text: While you are at Fauborg Marigny, reduce the cost of each asset you play by 1. [action]: Resign. "We can't catch the beast!" You make your way to safety, letting the beast roam free.

name: Forgotten Marsh
text: Forced - When you leave Forgotten Marsh: Lose 2 resources.

name: Trapper's Cabin
text:
While you are at Trapper's Cabin, you cannot gain resources.
[action] Spend 5 resources: Test [intellect] (3) to convince an old trapper to sell you his last bear trap. If you succeed, take control of the set-aside Bear Trap asset.

name: Twisted Underbrush
text: [action]: Gain 2 resources and take 1 horror.

name: Foul Swamp
text:
While you are at Foul Swamp, you cannot heal horror or cancel horror.
