[action] Take up to 3 horror: Test [willpower] (7) to search the boneyard. You get +1 [willpower] for this test for each horror taken as part of this ability's cost. If you succeed, remember that the investigators have "found an ancient binding stone."

name: Ritual Grounds
text: Forced - After you end your turn at Ritual Grounds: Draw 1 card and take 1 horror.

name: Overgrown Cairns
text: [action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.)

name: Lady Esprit
text: [action] Exhaust Lady Esprit and deal her 1 horror: Heal 2 damage or gain 2 resources. Any investigator at Lady Esprit's location may activate this ability.

name: Bear Trap
text: [free]: Attach Bear Trap to your location. Forced - After The Rougarou enters attached location: Attach Bear Trap to The Rougarou. Attached enemy gets -1 fight and -1 evade.

name: Fishing Net
text:
[free] If The Rougarou is exhausted and at your location: Attach Fishing Net to The Rougarou.
Attached enemy loses retaliate.

name: Bog Gator
text: Prey - Lowest [agility]. While Bog Gator is at a Bayou location, it gets +2 fight and +2 evade.

name: Swamp Leech
text: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Swamp Leech cannot be evaded. Forced - When Swamp Leech enters a non-[[Bayou]] location: Discard it.

name: Cursed Swamp
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage. If you are at a [[Bayou]] location, you cannot commit cards to this skill test.

name: Spectral Mist
text: Revelation - Attach to a [[Bayou]] location. Limit 1 per location. Each skill test performed at attached location gets +1 difficulty. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to disrupt the source of the mist. If you suceed, discard Spectral Mist.

name: Dragged Under
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, add Dragged Under to your threat area. Forced - When you leave your current location: take 2 damage and discard Dragged Under. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Dragged Under.

name: Ripples on the Surface
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. If you are at a [[Bayou]] location, you cannot commit cards to this skill test.

name: The Rougarou
text: Aloof. Retaliate. As an additional cost for an investigator to engage The Rougarou, the investigators must spend 1 clue, as a group (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators). Forced - After The Rougarou takes 1 [per_investigator] damage during a single phase: Find the location that is farthest from all investigator. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.

name: Curse of the Rougarou
text: Revelation - Put Curse of the Rougarou into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you have not dealt any damage this turn: Take 1 horror.

name: Monstrous Transformation
text: Fast. Set the base value of your [willpower] and [intellect] to 2. Set the base value of your [combat] and [agility] to 5. [action] Exhaust Monstrous Transformation: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack.

name: Slime-Covered Dhole
text: Spawn - Any non-[[Bayou]] location. Prey - Lowest remaining health. Hunter. Forced - When Slime-Covered Dhole enters a location: Each investigator at that location takes 1 horror.

name: Marsh Gug
text: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Hunter.

name: Dark Young Host
text: Spawn - Any [[Bayou]] location. Forced - When 1 or more clues are placed on Dark Young Host's location: Place those clues on Dark Young Host. Forced - When Dark Young Host is defeated: Move all clues on Dark Young Host to its location.

name: On the Prowl
text: Surge. Revelation - Find a non-[[Bayou]] location with the fewest clues on it. Move The Rougarou (one location at a time) until it enters that location.

name: Beast of the Bayou
text: Revelation - The Rougarou makes an immediate attack against each investigator at The Rougarou's location and each connecting location. If no attacks were made by this effect, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

name: Insatiable Bloodlust
text: Revelation - Attach to The Rougarou. The Rougarou gets +1 fight, +1 damage, +1 horror, and cannot be evaded. Forced - After The Rougarou takes damage: Discard Insatiable Bloodlust.

name: Baleful Reveler
text: Spawn - The nearest location with no investigators counter-clockwise from the lead investigator. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Baleful Reveler moves from the hunter keyword, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, resolve its hunter keyword again. (Limit once per round.)

name: Chaos at the Carnevale
text: Forced - After a Writhing Appendage enters play: Place 2 doom on it.

name: The Carnevale Conspiracy
text: [action] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Look at the other side of a Masked Carnevale-Goer at any location. Objective - If there are a total of 3 Innocent Revelers underneath the act and/or agenda decks, advance.

name: Get to the Boats!
text: Forced - After the mythos phase begins: Choose a Masked Carnevale-Goer in play and flip it to its other side. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Canal-side, advance.

name: Gondola
text: Revelation - Put Gondola into play and move each investigator to it. Then, remove all other locations from the game. Remove from the game each enemy and asset at those locations, as well. [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (2) to row as hard as you can. If you succeed, place 1 resource from the token bank on this location.

name: Row!
text: Forced - When you would draw the top card of the encounter deck: Instead look at the top 5 cards of the encounter deck and put each Writhing Appendage among those cards into play, engaged with you. Discard the rest of those cards. Objective - If there are 4 [per_investigator] resources on Gondola, advance.

name: San Marco Basilica
text:
San Marco Basilica is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action]: Place an Innocent Reveler you control underneath the act deck, out of play.

name: Canal-side
text:
Canal-side is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[reaction] After you enter Canal-side: Place 1 clue on Canal-side from the token bank.

name: Streets of Venice
text: Streets of Venice is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. [free]: Move (to the location in the clockwise direction).

name: Rialto Bridge
text: Rialto Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Rialto Bridge: Lose 1 action.

name: Venetian Garden
text:
Venetian Garden is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action] [action] Spend 2 resources: Heal 2 horror. (Limit once per game.)

name: Bridge of Sighs
text: Bridge of Sighs is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Bridge of Sighs: Take 1 horror.

name: Flooded Square
text:
Flooded Square is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[action]: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at the location in the counter-clockwise direction. (Group limit once per turn.)

name: Accademia Bridge
text: Accademia Bridge is connected to the location in the clockwise direction. Forced - After you leave Accademia Bridge: Lose 2 resources.

name: The Guardian
text:
The Guardian is connected to the location in the clockwise direction.
[reaction] After you enter The Guardian: Draw 1 card.

name: Don Lagorio
text:
Hunter.
While resolving the hunter keyword on Don Lagorio, his location is connected to the location in the counter-clockwise direction, as well as the clockwise direction.

name: Masked Carnevale-Goer
text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Flip Masked Carnevale-Goer. If its other side is an enemy, it attacks each investigator in its location.

name: Elisabetta Magro
text: Aloof. Forced - When you look at Elisabetta Magro using the ability on Act 1a: Flip her to this side. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 doom on Elisabetta Magro.

name: Salvatore Neri
text:
Retaliate.
Salvatore Neri's fight value is equal to the attacking investigator's base [combat].
Salvatore Neri's evade value is equal to the evading investigator's base [agility].

name: Savio Corvi
text:
Hunter.
While resolving the hunter keyword on Savio Corvi, his location is connected to the location across from him, as well as in the clockwise direction.

name: Innocent Reveler
text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to convince the reveler to follow you to safety. If you succeed, take control of Innocent Reveler. Forced - When Innocent Reveler would be discarded: Place it underneath the agenda deck, out of play. Each investigator takes 1 horror.

name: Abbess Allegria Di Biase
text: [free]: Exhaust Abbess Allegria Di Biase: Move from her location to a connecting location, or to her location from a location connected to it. Any investigator may trigger this ability.

name: Bauta
text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Bauta enters play: Gain 2 resources.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[combat] test, discard Bauta: Use [combat] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.

name: Medico Della Peste
text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Medico Della Peste enters play: You heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[willpower] test, discard Medico Della Peste: Use [willpower] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.

name: Pantalone
text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Pantalone enters play: Draw 2 cards.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[intellect] test, discard Pantalone: Use [intellect] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.

name: Gilded Volto
text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] in play.
[reaction] After Gilded Volto enters play: Treat the next asset you play this turn as if it has fast.
[reaction] When you initiate a non-[agility] test, discard Gilded Volto: Use [agility] for this test, instead of the skill indicated.

name: Cnidathqua
text: You may fight Cnidathqua as if it were at your location (it is not engaged with you). Cnidathqua cannot be evaded. Forced - After you fail a test while attacking Cnidathqua: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Writhing Appendage and spawn it engaged with you. Objective - If Cnidathqua is defeated, (→R2).

name: Poleman
text: Spawn - Canal-side. Prey - Most Innocent Revelers controlled. Hunter.

name: Carnevale Sentinel
text: Spawn - The location across from you. Retaliate. You cannot look at the other side of Masked Carnevale-Goers at Carnevale Sentinel's location using the ability on Act 1a.

name: Writhing Appendage
text: Retaliate. Forced - After Writhing Appendage attacks you: Discard a random card from your hand. Forced - When Writhing Appendage is defeated, if Cnidathqua is in play: Deal 1 damage to Cnidathqua.

name: Mass Hysteria
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 2 damage or take each Masked Carnevale-Goer, shuffle them so the investigators do not know which is which, and place 1 in each location, starting with the location clockwise from you (Masked Carnevale-Goer side face-up).

name: Lost in Venice
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either take 2 horror or move to the location across from you.

name: Watchers' Gaze
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). Each investigator who controls an Innocent Reveler must also perform this skill test. Each investigator who fails takes 1 horror, which must be assigned to Innocent Reveler first, if able.

name: Chaos in the Water
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). Each investigator who controls an Innocent Reveler must also perform this skill test. Each investigator who fails takes 1 damage, which must be assigned to an Innocent Reveler first, if able.

name: Mesmerize
text: Revelation - If there are no Masked Carnevale-Goers at your location, Mesmerize gains surge. If there is a Masked Carnevale-Goer at your location, flip it. If it is an Innocent Reveler, move it to the farthest location clockwise from you with no investigators, then deal it 1 damage and 1 horror.

name: Abduction
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either lose all of your resources or choose and discard an [[Ally]] asset you control.

name: Jessie's Request
text: [action] Investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Randomly spawn one of the enemies beneath the scenario reference card.

name: Curse of the Abyss
text: Forced - If the strength of the abyss is 0: Set the strength of the abyss to 1. Each investigator draws 1 card and heals 1 horror.

name: Garden of Shadows
text: Forced - If the strength of the abyss is 0 or 1: Set the strength of the abyss to 2. Each investigator either draws 1 card or heals 1 horror.

name: Curse of Endless Sleep
text: Forced - After a [[Brotherhood]] enemy enters the victory display: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side. Objective - Find as many [[Evidence]] cards as you can and add them to the victory display before the agenda advances. (If there are 6 [[Evidence]] cards in the victory display, advance.)

name: Secrets in the Sand
text: Clues cannot be placed on [[Cairo]] locations. [action] If you are at an [[Expedition]] location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.

name: The Hour of Judgment
text: [action] If there is a dreamer at your location: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (X) to attempt to awaken a dreamer. X is the strength of the abyss. If you succeed, move a dreamer from your location to Neith, as damage. Objective - If Neith has no remaining health, advance.

name: Streets of Cairo
text: Forced - After you discover 2 or more clues at Streets of Cairo during a single turn: Take 1 horror. [action] If there are no clues on Streets of Cairo: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a door marked with blood."

name: Cairo Bazaar
text:
While you are at Cairo Bazaar, reduce the cost of each [[Item]] asset you play by 1 and increase the cost of each other asset you play by 1.
[action] Spend 10 resources: Remember that you "bought an odd trinket."

name: Museum of Egyptian Antiquities
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (5). If you succeed, remember that you have "discovered an ancient tablet." Forced - After you investigate Museum of Egyptian Antiquities, if you did not succeed by at least 2: Lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.

name: Outskirts of Cairo
text: [action] Choose and discard 5 cards from your hand: Remember that you have "sabotaged the train." [action] If no investigator has "sabotaged the train": Resign. You take the train out of Cairo, leaving the dreamers to their unceasing nightmare.

name: Temple Courtyard
text:
While there are no clues remaining on Temple Courtyard, each copy of Humble Supplicant loses aloof.
[action]: Test [combat] (5). If you succeed, remember that you have "broken into a deserted temple."

name: Neith
text: Hunter. Retaliate Forced - After horror from Neith's attack defeats an investigator or [[Ally]] asset: That card is "taken by the abyss." Forced - When Neith is dealt any amount of damage from an attack, if there is at least 1 dreamer at her location: Remove 1 dreamer from her location and cancel 1 damage just dealt to Neith.

name: Humble Supplicant
text: Spawn - Any [[Cairo]] location (with a [[Brotherhood]] enemy, if able). Aloof. Each [[Brotherhood]] enemy at Humble Supplicant's location cannot be attacked or damaged. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Move Humble Supplicant once toward the nearest [[Brotherhood]] enemy, if able.

name: Creature from the Abyss
text: Retaliate. X is the strength of the abyss. Forced - After Creature from the Abyss enters play, if the strength of the abyss is 2 or lower: Add 1 strength to the abyss. Forced - After Creature from the Abyss is defeated, if the strength of the abyss is 5 or higher: Remove 1 strength from the abyss.

name: Schemes in the Dark Beyond
text: Investigators cannot Parley with [[Brotherhood]] enemies. Each [[Brotherhood]] enemy cannot be flipped over. Forced - After the 4th or 8th doom is placed on this agenda: Add 1 strength to the abyss.

name: Search for the Gate
text: [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.

name: Into the Gate
text: [action]: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it. Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at the Eldritch Gate and they spend the requisite number of clues, advance.

name: The Night's Usurper
text: Objective - "We have to find a way to stop him!" If Xzharah is exhausted, an investigator at his location may choose to advance. (Limit once per phase.)

name: A Dream Betwixt
text: Forced - If the strength of the abyss is 0: Set the strength of the abyss to 1. [reaction] After you successfully investigate A Dream Betwixt: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

name: The Great Abyss
text: [reaction] After you discover the last remaining clue from The Great Abyss: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

name: Tunnels under Ngranek
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to search for signs of life within these jagged tunnels. If you succeed, flip this location over and resolve the text on its other side.

name: Stairway to Sarkomand
text: [action]: Test [willpower] (3) to navigate the bewildering and gravity-defying staircase. If you succeed, flip this location over and resolve the text on its other side.

name: Mist-Filled Caverns
text: [action]: Test [agility] (4) to traverse through the mist. If you succeed, flip this location over and resolve the text on its other side.

name: Xzharah
text: Hunter. Retaliate Xzharah gets +5 [per_investigator] health and cannot be defeated by damage. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (X), where X is the strength of the abyss. If you succeed, flip this enemy over and resolve the text on its other side. If you fail, Xzharah attacks you.

name: Dreaded Shantak
text:
Hunter. Massive.
While Dreaded Shantak is ready, [action] and [reaction] abilities on its location cannot be triggered.

name: Speaker for the Dark Pharaoh
text: While the strength of the abyss is 2 or lower, Speaker for the Dark Pharaoh gains hunter. Forced - After Speaker for the Dark Pharaoh is defeated, if the strength of the abyss is 3 or higher: Each investigator at its location takes 1 damage.

name: Dr. Layla El Masri
text: Spawn - Expedition Camp. [action] As a group, investigators at Dr. Layla El Masri's location discard cards from hand with a total of at least 4 [willpower] icons among them: Parley. Add Dr. Layla El Masri to the victory display.

name: Dr. Wentworth Moore
text: Spawn - Museum of Egyptian Antiquities. Dr. Wentworth Moore cannot be damaged while there is a ready [[Monster]] enemy at his location. Forced - After Dr. Wentworth Moore enters play: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Monster]] enemy, and spawn it at his location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Nadia Nimr
text: Spawn - Temple Courtyard. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (7). You may take up to 3 horror to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2 for each horror taken in this way. If you succeed, add Nadia Nimr to the victory display. If you fail, Nadia Nimr attacks you.

name: Farid
text: Spawn - Cairo Bazaar. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (7). You may spend up to 5 resources to reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each resource spent in this way. If you succeed, add Farid to the victory display. If you fail, Farid attacks you.

name: Nassor
text: Spawn - Streets of Cairo. Retaliate. Forced - When Nassor attacks: Either add 1 strength to the abyss, or Nassor deals +1 damage and +1 horror for this attack (+2 damage and +2 horror instead if it is the enemy phase).

name: Professor Nathaniel Taylor
text: Spawn - Outskirts of Cairo. [action] As a group, investigators at Professor Nathaniel Taylor's location discard cards from hand with a total of at least 4 [intellect] icons among them: Parley. Add Professor Nathaniel Taylor to the victory display.

name: Expedition Camp
text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to speak to the researchers stationed here. If you succeed, look at the top X cards of either the exploration deck or the encounter deck, where X is the amount you succeeded by. Place up to 2 of those cards on the bottom of that deck. Place the rest on top in a random order. (Group limit once per round.)

name: Nile River
text: Forced - After you enter Nile River: You must either take 1 horror or discard 1 card from your hand at random.

name: Sands of Dashur
text: As an additional cost for you to explore while at Sands of Dashur, you must spend 2 resources.

name: Dunes of the Sahara
text: Forced - After you enter Dunes of the Sahara: You must either take 1 damage or lose 1 action.

name: Untouched Vault
text:
Each [[Monster]] enemy at Untouched Vault gets +2 fight and +1 damage value.
[action] If a [[Monster]] enemy was defeated here this round: You stare into the creature's dead eyes, and the abyss stares back at you. Remove 1 strength from the abyss. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Faceless Sphinx
text:
X is the strength of the abyss.
[action] If you have at least 2 clues: You stare into the sphinx's empty face, and the abyss stares back at you. Place 2 of your clues on Faceless Sphinx and remove 1 strength from the abyss. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Desert Oasis
text:
[action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror. (Limit once per game.)
[action] [action] If you have no horror on you: You stare into the reflection on the water, and the abyss stares back at you. Take 3 horror and remove 1 strength from the abyss. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Sandswept Ruins
text:
While you are investigating Sandswept Ruins, if you have 5 or more cards in your hand, it gets +3 shroud.
[action] [action] If you have 8 or more cards in your hand: You stare into the swirling sands, and the abyss stares back at you. Discard 3 cards from your hand at random and remove 1 strength from the abyss. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Abyssal Revenant
text: Spawn - Farthest [[Desert]] or [[Otherworld]] location. Hunter. Forced - When Abyssal Revenant attacks during the enemy phase: Instead of its standard damage, it deals X damage for this attack, where X is the strength of the abyss. If this attack defeats an investigator or [[Ally]] asset, that card is "taken by the abyss."

name: Thing in the Sarcophagus
text: Spawn - The location with the most clues. While its location has no clues, Thing in the Sarcophagus gains hunter. Forced - While Thing in the Sarcophagus is ready, when you attack it by any means except a [[Ranged]], [[Firearm]], or [[Spell]] card: It immediately attacks you.

name: Eclipse
text: While you are at an [[Otherworld]] location, Eclipse gains peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or choose an [[Ally]] asset at your location to be defeated and "taken by the abyss."

name: Sandstorm
text: While you are at an [[Desert]] location, Sandstorm gains peril. Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 damage or discard an asset you control.

name: Terror Under the Pyramids
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, choose and discard 1 card from your hand. For each card you cannot discard, take 1 horror.

name: Swarm of Locusts
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource. For each resource you cannot lose, take 1 damage.

name: Slumber
text: Revelation - Put Slumber into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area (if there is, discard Slumber and it gains surge instead). Forced - When your turn begins: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, lose 1 action. [reaction] After strength is removed from the abyss: Discard Slumber.

name: Dark Sacrifice
text: Revelation - Put Dark Sacrifice into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area (if there is, discard Dark Sacrifice and it gains surge instead). Forced - After strength is added to the abyss: Take 1 damage and 1 horror. If this effect defeats an [[Ally]] asset or investigator, that card is "taken by the abyss." [reaction] After strength is removed from the abyss: Discard Dark Sacrifice.

name: The Black Wind
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Add 1 strength to the abyss and add The Black Wind to the victory display. - Discard The Black Wind and draw the top card of the encounter deck to replace it. You get -1 to all skills for the remainder of this round.

name: Abyssal Reach
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (X). X is the strength of the abyss. If you fail by: - exactly 1, place 1 of your clues on your location. - exactly 2, take 1 damage and 1 horror. - exactly 3, you cannot play cards this round. - 4 or more, place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance).

name: John & Jessie Burke
text: [action] Exhaust John & Jessie Burke and deal them 1 damage: Choose an enemy in a connecting location. Move to that enemy's location. Then, engage that enemy and deal it 1 damage.

name: Ancient Ankh
text:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a test by more than 1, spend 1 charge: That investigator fails by 1, instead (even if he or she automatically failed).

name: Khopesh of the Abyss
text: [action]: Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. [reaction] After you defeat an enemy using Khopesh of the Abyss, exhaust it: Choose an enemy at another revealed location. Disengage from each other enemy engaged with you and move to the chosen enemy's location. Then, engage that enemy.

name: Summoned Nightgaunt
text: Uses (3 whistles). If Summoned Nightgaunt has no whistles, or if it leaves play, remove it from the game. [action] Spend 1 whistle and take 1 horror: Evade. Automatically evade all non-[[Nightgaunt]] enemies engaged with you and move to any revealed location.

name: The Murder
text: If there is only 1 investigator in the game, this agenda gets +1 doom threshold.

name: Special Investigation
text: Forced - After an investigator at the same location as a ready [[Police]] enemy discovers 1 or more clues at that location or deals damage to a [[Humanoid]] enemy: Each ready [[Police]] enemy at that location engages that investigator and makes an immediate attack.

name: What Happened...?
text: [action] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues as a group: Draw the top card of the Leads deck. Objective - If the investigators control two [[Lead]] assets, advance.

name: Following Leads
text: Objective - Learn more about your leads by placing clues on them (using abilities on some locations). The more clues, the better. At the end of the round, you may choose to advance if each [[Lead]] asset has at least 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. (Hint: If you wish to present this evidence to the police, you may wish to have at least 2 [per_investigator] clues on each [[Lead]] asset, instead.)

name: Bloodstained Dagger
text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Exhaust Bloodstained Dagger and take 1 horror: Fight. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If this attack defeats an enemy, draw 1 card.

name: What Have You Done?
text: Revelation - Put What Have You Done? into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to parley, you must discard a card at random from your hand. [action]: Shuffle What Have You Done? into your deck.

name: Sergeant Monroe
text:
Sergeant Monroe may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to any investigator at his location, even if he is uncontrolled.
[reaction] When Sergeant Monroe is dealt any amount of damage or horror, exhaust him: Deal that much damage to a non-[[Innocent]] enemy at his location. Any investigator at Sergeant Monroe's location may trigger this ability.

name: Arkham Officer
text: Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with clues). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move 1 clue to Arkham Officer from its location, flipping it to its doom side. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, either automatically evade Arkham Officer, or flip one of its doom to its clue side and take control of it.

name: Room 225
text:
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "cleaned up the blood."
[action]: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "hid the body."
[action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, remember that the investigators "tidied up the room."

name: Suite Balcony
text: [action]: Choose a [[Humanoid]] enemy at Suite Balcony and test [combat] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, take 1 direct horror and defeat the chosen enemy (if that enemy is [[Elite]], deal 2 damage to it instead). This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

name: Second Floor Hall
text: [reaction] After you enter this location: You may immediately move to a connecting location. If you do, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, draw the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Foyer
text: [action]: Resign. You flee the scene of the crime. Forced - When you attempt to move out of the Foyer while there is at least 1 [[Guest]] enemy here: Test [agility] (X), where X is the number of [[Guest]] enemies here. If you fail, you must spend 1 additional action to move out of the Foyer.

name: Restaurant
text: [action] Spend 2 resources: You place an order while enduring the withering glares of the entire waitstaff. At the end of your turn, if you are still at the Restaurant, you may take 1 horror to heal 3 damage. (Limit once per game.) [free] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Restaurant (from the token bank.)

name: Hotel Roof
text:
[action]: Test [agility] (4) or [combat] (4). If you succeed, move to either Room 212, Room 225, or Room 245.
[action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators at this location to Alien Device (if it is in play).

name: Room 212
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators at this location to Sinister Solution (if it is in play).

name: Room 245
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (3). Only the top card of your discard pile may be committed to this skill test (place it on the bottom of your deck after this test resolves). If you succeed, move any number of clues controlled by investigators in Room 245 to Time-Worn Locket (if it is in play).

name: Office
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, you may move 1 clue controlled by an investigator in the Office to Manager's key (if it is in play).

name: Basement
text:
[action]: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, move a [[Humanoid]] enemy at any location once toward the Basement.
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy in the Basement: Move any number of clues controlled by investigators at the Basement to Tome of Rituals (if it is in play).

name: Mr. Trombly
text: Spawn - Foyer. Hunter. Forced - After Mr. Trombly enters play: Immediately resolve the hunter and patrol keywords on each other [[Staff]] enemy in play.

name: Conspicuous Staff
text: Spawn - Nearest [[Crime Scene]] location. Prey - Most clues. Hunter.

name: Hotel Guest
text: Spawn - Nearest [[Hall]] location. Aloof. Patrol (nearest [[Crime Scene]] location). Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Hotel Guest is at a [[Crime Scene]] location: Add 1 doom to Hotel Guest. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Hotel Guest.

name: Noxious Fumes
text: Revelation - In player order, each investigator at your location must choose: - Test [agility] (3) to attempt to flee before the gas fills the room. If you succeed, move to a connecting location. If you fail, take 2 damage. - Test [combat] (3) to attempt to hold your breath. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.

name: Driven to Madness
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Humanoid]] enemies in play, Driven to Madness gains surge. Otherwise, attach Driven to Madness to the nearest [[Humanoid]] enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade. Attached enemy loses aloof. Investigators cannot parley with attached enemy. Forced - After attached enemy is evaded: Discard Driven to Madness.

name: Blood on your Hands
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each [[Innocent]] enemy in the victory display. If you fail, take 2 horror (if you are at a [[Crime Scene]] location, you must also choose and discard a card from your hand).

name: Incriminating Evidence
text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest non-[[Crime Scene]] location. Attached location gains the [[Crime Scene]] trait and gets +2 shroud. [reaction] When you successfully investigate attached location: Instead of discovering clues, discard Incriminating Evidence.

name: Violent Outburst
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Humanoid]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Humanoid]] enemy, draw it, and shuffle the encounter deck. Otherwise, the nearest [[Humanoid]] enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, engages you, and makes an immediate attack.

name: Alien Device
text: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Alien Device to another investigator.

name: Otherworldly Meddler
text: Retaliate. Forced - When Otherworldly Meddler would take damage from an attack: Remove 1 doom from Otherworldly Meddler. Then, reduce the damage dealt by 1. Forced - After an investigator is defeated: Add 3 doom to Otherworldly Meddler.

name: Encephalon Signal
text: Peril. Revelation - Place 1 doom on Otherworldly Meddler (if it is in play) and test [willpower] (4). If you fail, you must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Deal 2 damage to an investigator or [[Humanoid]] enemy at your location.

name: Manager's Key
text: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Manager's Key to another investigator.

name: Hotel Manager
text: Massive. Retaliate. Each [[Guest]] enemy loses patrol and gains surge. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Add 1 [[Guest]] enemy at Hotel Manager's location to the victory display, then place 2 doom on Hotel Manager. Move each other Guest enemy one location toward Hotel Manager.

name: Hotel Security
text: Spawn - Nearest empty location. Hunter. Retaliate. If there is at least 1 [[Guest]] enemy in play, Hotel Security loses hunter and gains "Patrol (nearest location with a [[Guest]] enemy)."

name: Tome of Rituals
text: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Tome of Rituals to another investigator.

name: Dimensional Shambler
text: Hunter. Forced - After Dimensional Shambler deals you damage from its attack: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If an [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, it snatches you from this dimension; remove Dimensional Shambler from the game and you are defeated.

name: Cultist of the Enclave
text: Spawn - Basement. Hunter. Forced - After Cultist of the Enclave attacks: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

name: Sinister Solution
text: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Sinister Solution to another investigator.

name: Harvested Brain
text: Forced - At the end of the investigation phase: Each investigator at attached location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Each other investigator must either take 1 damage or 1 horror (their choice).

name: Morbid Awareness
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (6). Reduce the difficulty of this test by 1 for each location away from Room 212 you are. If you fail, you must either place 1 of your clues on your location, or take 2 horror.

name: Time-Worn Locket
text: Revelation - Put into play in your play area. Forced - When you are defeated: Give control of Time-Worn Locket to another investigator.

name: Vengeful Specter
text: Patrol (Room 245). Retaliate. Forced - When damage would be placed on Vengeful Specter: Reduce that damage to 1 unless it was dealt by a [[Spell]], [[Relic]], [[Charm]], or encounter card.

name: Chilling Presence
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror. For each point you succeed by, you may deal 1 damage to a [[Geist]] enemy at your location. If an [elder_sign] symbol is revealed during this test, you may deal 2 damage to a [[Geist]] enemy at any location.

name: The True Culprit (v. I)
text: Alien Device gains: "[action] If Vengeful Specter is exhausted and at your location, remove 2 clues from Alien Device: Deal 2 damage to Vengeful Specter." Objective - If Vengeful Specter is defeated, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. II)
text: Sinister Solution gains: "[action] If you are in Room 212: Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, you may remove 2 clues from Sinister Solution to either exhaust Otherworldly Meddler or deal it 2 damamge." Objective - If Otherworldly Meddler is defeated, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. III)
text: Alien Device gains: "[action] Exhaust Alien Device and remove 2 clues from it: Add a [[Staff]] enemy at your location to the victory display (or deal it 2 damage if it is [[Elite]]). Does not provoke attacks of opportunity." Objective - If Hotel Manager is defeated, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. IV)
text: Tome of Rituals gains: "[action] Remove 2 clues from Tome of Rituals: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. If you succeed, instead of dealing damage, remove 3 doom from the attacked enemy." Objective - If Otherworldly Meddler is defeated or has no doom on it, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. V)
text: Sinister Solution gains: "[action] If Vengeful Specter is at your location: Test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by, move 1 clue from Sinister Solution to Vengeful Specter. Does not provoke attacks of opportunity." Objective - If Vengeful Specter is defeated or has clues on it equal to its remaining health, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. VI)
text: Time-Worn Locket gains: "[reaction] When Hotel Manager would attack an investigator at your location, remove 2 clues from Time-Worn Locket: Cancel that attack." Objective - If Hotel Manager is defeated, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. VII)
text: Each [[Guest]] enemy loses Victory 0, loses [[Innocent]], and gains [[Cultist]]. Each [[Lead]] asset gains: "[action] If Dimensional Shambler is at your location, remove 1 clue from this asset: Evade. Automatically evade Dimensional Shambler. Objective - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. VIII)
text: Each [[Lead]] asset gains: "[action] Remove 1 clue from this asset: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Staff]] enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck." [reaction] After a [[Staff]] enemy is defeated, Deal 1 horror to Harvested Brain. Objective - If there is 2 plus 1 [per_investigator] horror on Harvested Brain, advance.

name: The True Culprit (v. IX)
text: Room 212 gains: "[action] If Tome of Rituals is at this location: Test [willpower] (5) or [intellect] (5). If you succeed, move up to 1 [per_investigator] clues from Tome of Rituals to Harvested Brain. Objective - If Harvested Brain has 3 [per_investigator] clues on it, advance

name: The True Culprit (v. X)
text: Each [[Guest]] enemy loses Victory 0, loses [[Innocent]], and gains [[Cultist]]. Basement gains: "[action]: Test [willpower] (4) or [agility] (4). You may remove 1 clue from a [[Lead]] asset in the Basement to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, remove 1 doom from the agenda. Objective - If there is no doom on this agenda, advance.

name: The Anomaly Spreads
text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).

name: The Anomaly Swells
text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).

name: The Anomaly Consumes
text: Each location is connected to each location adjacent to it (orthogonally).

name: Expose the Anomaly
text: *This act has a global clue threshold (see page 6 of the rules for details). Only clues on copies of this act among all groups contribute to the global clue threshold. [free] Place up to 3 of your clues on this act. (Limit once per round.) Objective - At the start of the round, if the global clue threshold has been reached, you must advance. The event organizer will announce when this threshold has been reached. (Beware - advancing will expose the anomaly's weak spot. Be ready for a fight.)

name: Expose the Anomaly
text: Objective - At the start of the round, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance. (Beware - advancing will expose the anomaly's weak spot. Be ready for a fight.)

name: Extraterrestrial Physiology
text: Forced - After any amount of damage is placed on Vulnerable Heart: Place twice that much damage on Subject 8L-08 as well. [free] While an investigator at your location is attacking Vulnerable Heart, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 [combat] for this attack. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance.

name: Blackwater's Bane
text: Each [[Ooze]] enemy gains retaliate and loses the Blob X keyword. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance. (The scenario will not end when this act advances.)

name: Blackwater's Bane
text: Each [[Ooze]] enemy gains retaliate and loses the Blob X keyword. Objective - At the end of the round, you must advance. (The scenario will not end when this act advances.)

name: The Crater
text: [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Deal 3 damage to Subject 8L-08 or a [[Manifold]] enemy at any location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at The Crater takes 1 damage.

name: Research Site
text: [action] Spend 2 clues: Gain 1 countermeasure. [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Place 2 clues on Research Site (from the token pool).

name: Temporary HQ
text:
[action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Choose one -
- Heal 3 damage.
- Heal 3 horror.
- Gain 5 resources.
- Draw 3 cards.

name: Fungus Mound
text: [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Choose a [[Mi-Go]] enemy at any location and test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, deal 1 damage to the chosen enemy (to a maximum of 5).

name: Sewer
text: [action]: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, move to a location up to X connections away from Sewer, where X is the amount you succeeded by.

name: Bridge
text: [free]: Choose an exhausted [[Manifold]] enemy at Bridge and test [intellect] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you succeed, defeat the chosen enemy. (Max one success per game.)

name: Water Tower
text: [action] If there are no clues on Water Tower: Test [intellect] (3) to find the structure's weakness. If you succeed, deal 3 damage to each [[Ooze]] enemy at Water Tower and at each connecting location. (Max one success per game.)

name: Church
text: [action] If there are no clues on Church: Choose an [[Ooze]] enemy at Church, or a connecting location. Move the chosen enemy one location away from Church and automatically evade it. (Group limit once per game.)

name: Oozy Lakebed
text: Forced - After a [[Manifold]] enemy spawns at Oozy Lakebed: Place 1 clue on Oozy Lakebed. That enemy cannot take damage this round.

name: Slimy Streets
text: Forced - After you discover any number of clues from Slimy Streets: Reveal that many random tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull] or [auto_fail] token revealed by this effect, take 1 damage or 1 horror.

name: Desiccated Farmland
text: While you are at Desiccated Farmland, you cannot gain resources. Forced - After you end your turn at Desiccated Farmland: Lose 1 resource.

name: University Chemist
text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 resource (from the token pool) on University Chemist. Then, if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on it, take control of it.

name: Meteorite Sample
text: If uncontrolled and unattached, attach Meteorite Sample to its location. If attached to a location with no clues on it, Meteorite Sample gains: "[action] Test [willpower] or [agility] (6). If you succeed, detach Meteorite Sample and take control of it."

name: Mi-Go General
text: Hunter. Forced - After Mi-Go General attacks you: Move 1 of your clues to Fungus Mound.

name: The Military's Plan
text: Horror tokens on locations represent explosives. Each location with explosives gains: "[action]: Test [intellect] or [agility] (3). If you succeed, remove the horror token on this location." Forced - At the end of the round: Remove 1 damage from this card.

name: Universal Solvent
text:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, discard an [[Obstacle]] treachery at your location.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is 1 more than that enemy's remaining health. If you succeed, that enemy is defeated. Does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

name: Pet Oozeling
text: [fast] Defeat a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location with 2 or less remaining health. Then, heal all damage from Pet Oozeling, place 1 resource on it, and reveal X chaos tokens, where X is the number of resources on it. If an [auto_fail] symbol is revealed, you are defeated and suffer 1 physical trauma.

name: Mi-Go Weapon
text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. The device fires a blast of entropic energy. You get +2 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If you succeed and the enemy is not defeated, move it one location away from you. (If you succeed by 3 or more, deal +1 damage and move the enemy an additional location away.)

name: Lt. Wilson Stewart
text:
[fast] Exhaust Lt. Wilson Stewart: Discard a card from your hand or from the top of your deck. Then, for each...
...[willpower] icon on that card, get +1 for your next test this round.
...[intellect] icon on that card, draw 1 card.
...[combat] icon on that card, heal 1 damage or horror from him.
...[agility] icon on that card, gain 1 resource.

name: Mi-Go Drone
text: Spawn - Location with the most clues (other than Fungus Mound). Surge. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if Mi-Go Drone is ready: Move 1 clue from Mi-Go Drone's location to Fungus Mound.

name: Mi-Go Harvester
text: While Mi-Go Harvester is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Meteorite Sample is attached to Mi-Go Harvester, move it once toward the Fungus Mound. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Harvester once toward Meteorite Sample's location. Then, if it is at the same location as Meteorite Sample, attach Meteorite Sample to it."

name: Mi-Go Meddler
text: While Mi-Go Meddler is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Mi-Go Meddler is at a location with explosives, remove 1 damage from The Military's Plan. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Meddler once toward a location with explosives."

name: Mi-Go Abductor
text: While Mi-Go Abductor is ready, it gains: "Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If Mi-Go Abductor is at University Chemist's location, deal 1 direct damage to University Chemist. Otherwise, move Mi-Go Abductor once toward University Chemist's location."

name: Subject 8L-08
text: *Subject 8L-08 has a global health pool (see page 6 of the rules for details). If Subject 8L-08 is defeated, proceed to (→R2).

name: Subject 8L-08
text: Subject 8L-08 gets +15 health. If Subject 8L-08 is defeated, proceed to (→R2).

name: Oozeling
text: Spawn - Any empty [[Oozified]] location. Blob 1.

name: Grasping Ooze
text: Spawn - Nearest [[Oozified]] location. Hunter. Forced - After you perform an attack against Grasping Ooze using a [[Melee]] card: Subject 8L-08 devours that card. Blob 3.

name: Cubic Ooze
text: Revelation - Immediately attempt to evade Cubic Ooze (without spending an action). If you fail, spawn Cubic Ooze engaged with you, and it attacks you. If you succeed, spawn Cubic Ooze at your location, exhausted and unengaged. Blob 2.

name: Oozewraith
text: Spawn - Farthest [[Oozified]] location. Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Blob 5.

name: Vulnerable Heart
text:
Massive. Retaliate.
X is the amount of damage on Vulnerable Heart.
Vulnerable Heart cannot be evaded and cannot make attacks of opportunity.
Vulnerable Heart cannot have more than 15 damage on it. All excess damage is canceled.

name: Reality Acid
text: Revelation - Subject 8L-08 devours a random aspect of reality. Reveal two random chaos tokens from the chaos bag and consult pages 16-19 of the rules to determine what it devoured. (If the combination of chaos tokens revealed is not listed, or if the listed aspect cannot be devoured, reveal two new chaos tokens and consult the chart again.)

name: Devouring Ooze
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, choose an [[Ally]] or [[Item]] asset you control. Subject 8L-08 devours that asset. (If you cannot, take 2 damage instead.)

name: Corrosive Slime
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, Subject 8L-08 devours either one of your resources or a random card from your hand.

name: Consuming Maw
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). Take 1 damage for each point you fail by. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect.

name: Wave of Ooze
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). Take 1 horror for each point you fail by. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect.

name: Caustic Dissemination
text: Revelation - Put Caustic Dissemination into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at an [[Oozified]] location takes 1 damage and 1 horror. Subject 8L-08 devours each card defeated by this effect. Discard Caustic Dissemination. (Max once per round.)

name: Sticky Feet
text: Revelation - Attach to the nearest [[Oozified]] location. As an additional cost to enter or leave attached location, an investigator must spend an action. [action] Spend 1 countermeasure: Discard Sticky Feet.

name: Replication
text: Revelation - Find the [[Manifold]] enemy with the most damage on it. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until another [[Manifold]] enemy with equal or lower printed health is discarded. Spawn that enemy at the same location, then distribute the damage that is on both enemies so that the remaining health on both enemies is as equal as possible. If no enemy is spawned by this effect, Replication gains surge.

name: "It's got me!"
text: Revelation - Put "It's got me!" into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 resource on "It's got me!" Then, if there are 6 or more resources on it, Subject 8L-08 devours you. [action] If you are at the Research Site, spend 1 countermeasure: Discard "It's got me!"

name: Alien Food Chain
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Manifold]] enemies in play, Alien Food Chain gains surge. Otherwise, attach to the [[Manifold]] enemy with the least remaining health and fully heal that enemy. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, and gains hunter.

name: The Summoning of Silenus
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next blue agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next blue agenda.

name: The Summoning Progresses
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next blue agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next blue agenda.

name: The Summoning Nears Completion
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside Silenus Descends agenda. If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside Silenus Descends agenda.

name: The Incubation of the Egg
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next green agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next green agenda.

name: The Incubation Progresses
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next green agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next green agenda.

name: The Incubation Nears Completion
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside The Egg Hatches agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside The Egg Hatches agenda.

name: The Proliferation of the Swarm
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next red agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next red agenda.

name: The Proliferation Progresses
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the next red agenda. - If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the next red agenda.

name: The Proliferation Nears Completion
text: *This agenda has a global doom threshold of 6 per group. Forced - When this agenda advances: - If you are playing in Single Group Mode, remove 6 doom from it and move all excess doom to the set-aside Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges agenda. If you are playing in Epic Multiplayer Mode, move all doom and wards from it to the set-aside Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges agenda.

name: War of the Outer Gods
text: Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - Investigators may only spend the requisite number of clues if no [[Cultist]] enemies are in play.

name: Close the Portal
text: [action] If you are at a [[Ritual Site]]: You try to seal off the portal. Place 1 of your clues around Hub Dimension. Then you may test [willpower] (2) or [intellect] (2). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues around Hub Dimension. Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - If your group has "sealed off the Hub Dimension," advance.

name: Close All Portals
text: [action] If you are at a [[Ritual Site]]: You try to seal off another portal. Test [willpower] (3) or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, place 1 of your clues around another group's Hub Dimension. Forced - When any amount of doom is placed on a player card: Place that amount of doom on any agenda as well. Objective - If each group has "sealed off the Hub Dimension," advance.

name: Hub Dimension
text:
Hub Dimension cannot have attachments.
Hub Dimension is connected to each [[Ritual Site]], and vice versa.
[action]: Test [willpower] (2) or [intellect] (2). If you succeed, spend 3 clues or remove 2 clues from around Hub Dimension to deal 2 damage to an [[Ancient One]] enemy (if you succeed by 3 or more, instead deal 3 damage).

name: Nihilistic Stargazer
text: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - Athenaeum of the Empty Sky. Forced - At the end of the round, if no green or red enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the blue agenda.

name: Death and Decay
text: Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - You and each asset you control take 1 direct damage. - Choose an [[Item]] asset you control and remove it from the game.

name: Zealot of Paradise
text: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - Shrine of Magh'an Ark'at. Forced - At the end of the round, if no blue or red enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the green agenda.

name: Predator's Call
text: Revelation - Attach Predator's Call to the nearest green enemy. If that enemy is [[Mutated]], place 1 resource on it, as a mutation. If no green enemies are in play, Predator's Call gains surge. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror.

name: Disciple of the Swarm
text: Aloof. Warring. Spawn - The Burning Pit. Forced - At the end of the round, if no blue or green enemies are in play: Place 1 doom on the red agenda.

name: Feast of Locusts
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each swarm card in play. If you fail, take 2 horror (if you fail by 4 or more, instead take 3 horror).

name: Hellfire
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, either take 2 damage or place 2 of your clues on your location (if you fail and have 4 or more clues, do both instead).

name: Ravages of War
text: Revelation - Each non-[[Elite]] enemy moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase. Enemies do not exhaust after attacking in this way. If no attacks were made as a result of this effect, Ravages of War gains surge.

name: While They Sleep
text: Revelation - For each faction that has the most enemies in play, place 1 doom on that faction's agenda. If no enemies are in play, place no doom and While They Sleep gains surge.

name: Silenus Descends
text: Each blue enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Silenus is defeated, (→R3).

name: Silenus
text: *Silenus has a global health pool of 8[per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Each investigator at Silenus's location must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Remove each card in your hand from the game. - Take 3 horror.

name: The Inescapable Maw
text:
Hunter.
Anytime an investigator is forced to "decide" by an ability on a blue encounter card, they must choose two options instead of one.

name: Hune-Stitched Herald
text: Warring. Forced - After Hune-Stitched Herald engages you: You must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Remove 2 clues from around Hub Dimension. - Hune-Stitched Herald attacks you.

name: Ethereal Entity
text: Warring. Spawn - Athenaeum of the Empty Sky. Forced - After Ethereal Entity engages you: You must decide (choose one) - - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Place 1 of your clues on your location. - Take 2 horror.

name: Inevitable End
text: Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the blue agenda. - Choose 3 cards in your hand and remove them from the game. - Remove the top 6 cards of your deck from the game. Shuffle each weakness removed this way into your deck.

name: The Egg Hatches
text: Each green enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Magh'an Ark'at is defeated, (→R4).

name: Magh'an Ark'at
text: *Magh'an Ark'at has a global health pool of 8[per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Place 1 resource on each [[Mutated]] enemy at Magh'an Ark'at's location, as a mutation. Deal 1 damage to each investigator at this location for each mutation on Magh'an Ark'at.

name: Vile Broodmaster
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Vile Broodmaster gets +1 health for each mutation on it. Forced - When 1 or more mutations would be placed on an enemy: Place 1 additional mutation on that enemy.

name: Horrific Shoggoth
text: Retaliate. Warring. Horrific Shoggoth gets +1 damage for each mutation on it. Forced - When Horrific Shoggoth attacks: Place 1 resource on it, as a mutation.

name: Bringer of Paradise
text: Aloof. Retaliate. Warring. Spawn - Shrine of Magh'an Ark'at. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 resource on Bringer of Paradise, as a mutation. Then, if there are 3 or more mutations on it, remove 2 of them and place 2 doom on the green agenda.

name: Hunt Down
text: Revelation - Place 1 resource on the [[Mutated]] enemy with the highest fight, as a mutation. That enemy readies, moves (one location at a time) until it reaches your location, and engages you. Then, it attacks you. If no [[Mutated]] enemies are in play, Hunt Down gains surge.

name: Ezel-zen-rezl Emerges
text: Each red enemy loses aloof, loses warring, and gains hunter. Objective - If Ezel-zen-rezl is defeated, (→R2).

name: Ezel-zen-rezl
text: *Ezel-zen-rezl has a global health pool of 7 [per_investigator]. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When the mythos phase ends: Each investigator at Ezel-zen-rezl's location chooses both a card from their hand and an asset they control and places them facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as swarm cards.

name: Droning Horde
text: Hunter. Swarming 6. Forced - After Droning Horde enters play: Each investigator chooses a card from their hand and places it facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as a swarm card. Forced - When Droning Horde attacks: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.

name: Trylogog
text: Swarming 2. Warring. Spawn - Burning Pit. Forced - When Trylogog attacks: It deals either its damage or its horror, instead of both.

name: Transmogrify
text: Revelation - Place an asset you control facedown underneath an [[Insect]] enemy as a swarm card. If no [[Insect]] is in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Trylogog and spawn it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Cloak of the Outer Realm
text:
Uses (4 charges).
[reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would engage you, spend 1 charge: Exhaust that enemy instead.

name: Pocket Portal
text: Fast. Forced - After Pocket Portal enters play: Place your investigator mini-card onto Pocket Portal and immediately end your turn. While your mini-card is on Pocket Portal, you are not at any location and enemies cannot spawn engaged with you. At the start of your turn, discard Pocket Portal and move to any revealed location.

name: Dreaded End
text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Choose one -
- Place a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location on top of the encounter deck.
- Look at the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Discard 2 of them and return the rest to the top, in any order.

name: Blade of Ark'at
text: [free] Exhaust Blade of Ark'at and spend 1 resource: Place 1 resource on Blade of Ark'at (from the token pool). [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for each resource on Blade of Ark'at. If you succeed, remove up to 3 resources from Blade of Ark'at to deal that much additional damage to the attacked enemy.

name: Enchanted Skull
text:
[free] Exhaust Enchanted Skull: Place the top card of your deck facedown underneath Enchanted Skull.
[free]: You get +1 to this skill test for each card underneath Enchanted Skull. Then discard 1 card from underneath Enchanted Skull, at random. (Limit once per turn.)

name: Daisy Walker
text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 sanity for each [[Tome]] asset you control.
[fast]: One at a time, resolve an [action] ability on each [[Tome]] asset you control, ignoring their [action] cost. (Limit once per game.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may return a [[Tome]] asset from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Daisy's Tote Bag
text:
Daisy Walker deck only. Advanced.
You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets.
[reaction] When you play a [[Tome]] asset during your turn, exhaust Daisy's Tote Bag: That asset gains fast.

name: The Necronomicon
text: Advanced. Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area, with 3 horror on it. It cannot leave play while it has 1 or more horror on it. While it is in play, treat each [elder_sign] you reveal on a chaos token as a [cultist], [tablet], and [elder_thing] (resolve all three). [action]: Move 1 horror from this card to Daisy Walker. Then, if The Necronomicon has no horror on it, discard it.

name: Mortal Inquiry
text:
Dr. Henry Armitage does not take up an ally slot and gains: "You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets."
"Jazz" Mulligan gains: "[action]: Move to a [[Miskatonic]] location up to 3 connections away."

name: Speed Reading
text: Ignore all Objectives on locations. [fast] If you are Daisy Walker, investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Shuffle 1 facedown player card beneath this location into your deck. Objective - Find a way to banish the Namer of the Dead before it is too late.

name: Namer of the Dead
text: Hunter. Prey - Daisy Walker only. Forced - When Namer of the Dead would be defeated: Instead, fully heal it, exhaust it, and move it to Orne Library. [action] If you are Daisy Walker and you control at least 4 non-weakness [[Tome]] assets: Parley. Text [willpower] (18). This test gets -2 difficulty for each [[Tome]] asset you control. If you succeed, advance the act.

name: "Skids" O'Toole
text:
[fast] Spend up to 3 resources: Test a base skill value of 3 against a difficulty equal to the amount of resources just spent. If you succeed, gain twice the number of spent resources. Only [agility] and [wild] skill icons may be committed to this test. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Choose a level 2 or less card in your discard pile. Add the chosen card to your hand.

name: On the Lam
text:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only. Advanced.
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you. At the end of the round, you may disengage from each engaged enemy and move up to 2 locations away.

name: Hospital Debts
text: Advanced. Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [fast]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit three times per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 9 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.

name: Eyes All Around You
text: [action] If you are in the Clover Club Cardroom, spend any number of clues: You cash in your chips. Gain 5 resources for each clue just spent. Forced - If "Skids" O'Toole is defeated: (→R2)

name: Playing Cards
text: Investigators cannot resign. Clover Club Pit Boss gains aloof. Forced - After a [[Criminal]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. Objective - At the end of the round: If an investigator has 15 or more resources, advance.

name: Hot on your Tail
text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains hunter and gets +1 health. Forced - When an investigator resigns: Place each of that investigator's resources on this act. Objective - Collect as many resources as you can and get out. When each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

name: Siobhan Riley
text: Forced - After Siobhan Riley engages you: For every 5 resources you have, lose 1 resource. Forced - After an investigator at Siobhan Riley's location gains 1 or more resources during the investigation phase: Siobhan Riley readies, engages that investigator, and makes an attack.

name: Clover Club Bouncer
text: When Clover Club Bouncer is engaged with you, it gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 5 resources you have. [action] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, disengage from Clover Club Bouncer and exhaust it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

name: Green Man Medallion
text:
Jenny Barnes deck only. Replacement.
[free] Spend up to 3 resources and exhaust Green Man Medallion: Place those resources on it, as offerings.
[reaction] When you resign or the game ends: For every 6 offerings on Green Man Medallion, reduce the experience cost of the next card you purchase before the next scenario by 1.

name: Sacrificial Beast
text: Jenny Barnes deck only. Replacement. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Jenny Barnes cannot gain resources via card effects.

name: Mysteries Remain
text: Roland Banks deck only. Replacement. Fast. Play only during your turn. Either place 1 clue (from the token bank) on your location, or discover 1 clue at your location. Remove Mysteries Remain from the game.

name: The Dirge of Reason
text: Roland Banks deck only. Replacement. Revelation - Place 2 of your clues on your location. If you cannot, place all of your clues on your location, take 1 horror, and shuffle The Dirge of Reason back into your deck.

name: Norman Withers
text: Play with the top card of your deck revealed. Once per round, you may play the top card of your deck as if it were in your hand, at -1 resource cost. Forced - After a weakness is revealed while on top of your deck: Draw it. [elder_sign] effect: +X. You may swap the top card of your deck with a card in your hand. X is the resource cost of the top card of your deck.

name: Split the Angle
text:
Norman Withers deck only. Replacement.
[action]: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck.
[free] Exhaust Split the Angle and discard the top card of your deck: Discard the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Vengeful Hound
text: Norman Withers deck only. Replacement. Prey - Norman Withers. While Vengeful Hounds is engaged with you, you cannot draw or reveal cards via player card effects.

name: Carolyn Fern
text:
[reaction] After one of your card effects heals horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset: The healed card's controller gains 1 resource.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may heal 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

name: Foolishness
text:
Carolyn Fern deck only. Replacement.
Foolishness enters play with 3 horror on him. Horror on him may be healed as if it were on Carolyn Fern. While Foolishness has no horror on him, you get +1 to all skills.

name: To Fight the Black Wind
text: Carolyn Fern deck only. Replacement. Revelation - Attach To Fight the Black Wind to the current agenda. Carolyn Fern takes 1 direct horror. Forced - At the end of the round, if any amount of horror was assigned to an investigator this round and it was not healed: Place 1 doom on attached agenda.

name: Silas Marsh
text:
[reaction] After you reveal a chaos token during a skill test you are performing. Return a skill you committed to this test to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may commit a skill from your discard pile to this test. After this test ends, return that skill to your hand instead of discarding it.

name: Nautical Prowess
text:
Silas Marsh deck only. Replacement.
If a chaos token with a negative modifier is revealed during this test, either draw 1 card or Nautical Prowess gains [wild][wild].

name: Dreams of the Deep
text: Silas Marsh deck only. Replacement. This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. If this skill test fails, return this skill to your hand. Forced - If Dreams of the Deep is in your hand at the end of your turn: Reveal it and take 2 damage.

name: Dexter Drake
text:
[free] During your turn, discard an asset you control: Play an asset with a different title from your hand, reducing its cost by 1. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may return an asset from your play area to your hand. Then, draw 1 card.

name: Molly Maxwell
text:
Dexter Drake deck only. Replacement.
[free] Exhaust Molly Maxwell and deal her 1 horror: Name any trait. One at a time, reveal cards from the top of your deck until an asset with the named trait is revealed. Draw that asset. Shuffle each other revealed card back into your deck.

name: Yaztaroth
text: Dexter Drake deck only. Replacement. Revelation - Put Yaztaroth into play in your threat area. You cannot play assets or put assests into play. [action] [action]: Discard Yaztaroth.

name: Gloria Goldberg
text:
You choose the investigator order during the mythos phase.
[reaction] When you look at 1 or more cards from the encounter deck: Look at 1 additional card and choose 1 non-[[Elite]] card among them. Either discard it, put it on top of the encounter deck, or place it facedown beneath Gloria Goldberg (max 3 cards beneath her).
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Look at the top card of the encounter deck.

name: Marie Lambeau
text:
While you have 1 or more doom among cards you control, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to play [[Spell]] cards or activate [[Spell]] [action] abilities.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may add 1 doom to or remove 1 doom from a card you control.

name: Mystifying Song
text:
Marie Lambeau deck only.
Fast. Play when the agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold.
Until the end of the phase, the agenda cannot advance by reaching its doom threshold. Remove Mystifying Song from the game.

name: Baron Samedi
text: Revelation - Put Baron Samedi into play. He cannot leave play while he has less than 3 doom on him. Forced - When any amount of damage is placed on an investigator in Baron Samedi's location: Place 1 additional damage on that investigator. [free] Exhaust Baron Samedi: Place 1 doom on Baron Samedi. If he has 3 or more doom on him, discard him.
